src: Passaðu þig að höndin þín sé eins afslöppuð og mögulegt er á meðan þú slærð rétt á allar nóturnar. Reyndu líka að hreyfa ekki fingurna of mikið ef ekki er þörf á því. Þannig munt þú þreyta þig sem minnst. Mundu að það er engin þörf á að slá á takkana með miklum krafti til að fá hærra hljóð eins og á píanóinu. Þú getur notað belg harmóníkunnar til að fá aukinn hljóðstyrk með því að beita meiri þrýstingi og hraða.
mt: 1. Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while you hit all the notes. Also, try not to move your fingers too much if it's not necessary. This will help you the least. 2. Don't hit the keys with too much force to get a louder sound like on the piano. You can use the bell of the harmonica to get more volume by applying more pressure and speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Eitt algengasta vandamálið þegar reynt er að breyta kvikmynd í DVD-snið 0er yfirskönnun. Flest sjónvörp eru framleidd á máta sem þóknast almenningi. Af þeirri ástæðu hefur allt sem sést í sjónvarpinu verið klippt á jöðrunum, uppi, niðri og á hliðunum. Þetta er gert til að tryggja að myndin nái yfir allan skjáinn. Það er kallað klipptur rammi. Því miður, ef gerður er mynddiskur, verða endarnir líklega klipptir líka og ef skjátextar eru of neðarlega munu þeir ekki sjást allir.
mt: 0er is the most common format for DVD movies. Most movies are made for the general public. For this reason, everything that is seen on television has been cut on the edges, up, down and on the sides. This is done to ensure that the image fits the entire screen. It is called a cut frame. However, if a movie is made on a disc, the ends are likely to be cut as well and if the subtitles are too low, they will not be seen all.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Ameríska áætlunin reiddi sig á samræmdar árásir úr þremur mismunandi áttum. John Cadwalder herforingi átti að hefja yfirvarpsárás gegn breska setuliðinu við Bordentown til þess að hindra allan liðsauka. James Ewing herforingi átti að fara með 700 uppreisnarhermenn yfir ána við Trenton Ferry, hertaka brúna yfir Assunpink Creek og koma í veg fyrir að óvinahermenn næðu að flýja. Aðal árásarher 2.400 manna myndi fara yfir ána níu mílum fyrir norðan Trenton og skiptast síðan í tvo hópa, einn undir forystu Greene og annar undir forystu Sullivan, til þess að hefja árás fyrir dögun.
mt: The American plan called for coordinated attacks from three directions. Brigadier General John Cadwalder was to lead an overland attack against the British garrison at Bordentown to prevent reinforcements. Brigadier General James Ewing was to lead 700 rebels across the river at Trenton Ferry, capture the bridge over Assunpink Creek, and prevent the enemy from escaping. The main attack force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton and split into two groups, one under Greene and the other under Sullivan, to attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "Þann 4. júlí um leið og þingið hafði samþykkt stjórnarskrána, undirrituðu John Hancock þingforseti og Charles Thomson þingritari handskrifuð drög hennar og sendu til prentsmiðju John Dunlap í nágrenninu. Þá nótt voru gerðar á bilinu 150 til 200 afrit, sem kallaðar eru ""Dunlap einblöðungarnir"". John Nixon las skjalið opinberlega í fyrsta sinn í garði Independence Hall þann 8. júlí. Eitt var sent til George Washington þann 6. júlí. Hann lét lesa það fyrir herliðið sitt í New York þann 9. júlí. Afrit barst til London þann 10. ágúst. Elstu afrit skjalsins sem vitað er um eru hinar 25 Dunlap fallbyssur. Handritaða afritið sem er upprunalegt hefur ekki varðveist."
mt: 4 July 1787, the day after the Congress had approved the Constitution, John Hancock, President of the Congress, and Charles Thomson, Secretary of the Congress, signed the document and sent it to the nearby printer John Dunlap. That night, 150 to 200 copies were printed, called the "Dunlap broadsides". John Nixon read the document publicly for the first time in the yard of Independence Hall on 8 July. One was sent to George Washington on 6 July. He had it read to his troops in New York on 9 July. Copies reached London on 10 August. The oldest copies known are the 25 Dunlap broadsides. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Nýlendubúarnir sem sáu þetta höfðu einnig kallað eftir liðsauka. Meðal hermanna sem styrktu framlínuna voru 1. og 3. sveit frá New Hampshire, 200 menn, undir stjórn John Stark ofursta og James Reed (þeir urðu báðir hershöfðingjar síðar). Menn Stark tóku sér stöðu meðfram girðingunni við norðurenda staðsetningar nýlenduherrans. Þegar op myndaðist meðfram Mystic River á mikilli fjöru, norðvestan megin á nesinu, lengdu þeir skjótlega girðinguna með stuttum steinvegg í norður, sem endar við vatnið á lítilli strönd. Gridley eða Stark setti niður stjaka um 100 fet (30 m) frá girðingunni og fyrirskipaði að enginn skyldi skjóta fyrr en óbreyttir borgarar væru farnir hjá.
mt: 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments, 200 men, under the command of John Stark and James Reed (both later became brigadier generals), took position along the riverbank at the north end of the encampment. When the sun rose over the Mystic River on a clear morning, northwest of the peninsula, they quickly extended the line with a short stone wall to the north, ending at the water on a small beach. Gridley or Stark lowered a flag about 100 feet (30 m) from the line and ordered no one to fire until the unengaged citizens were past.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Kína til forna notaði einstaka aðferð við að sýna ólík tímabil, hvert tímabil í sögu Kína eða hver valdaætt var aðgreind sem sérstakt keisaraveldi. Tímabilin á milli keisaraveldanna voru óstöðug og einkenndust af deilum innan héraðanna. Þekktasta skeiðið er keisaraveldi hinna þriggja konungsríkja sem varði í 60 ár eða mitt á milli Han og Jin keisaraveldanna. Á þessum tímabilum áttu sér stað hatrömm stríðsátök milli hinna ýmsu aðalsmanna sem börðust um krúnuna. Tími konungsríkjanna þriggja var eitt blóðugasta tímabil tímabils í sögu forn-Kína, þúsundir manna dóu í bardögum um að sitja í hæsta sæti í stórhöllinni í Xi’an.
mt: China has traditionally used a single method to show different periods, each period in the history of China or each ruling house was distinguished as a separate empire. The periods between the empires were unstable and characterized by disputes within the provinces. The best known period is the empire of the three kingdoms which lasted for 60 years or half between the Han and Jin empires. During this period there were fierce wars between the various nobles who fought for the crown. The time of the three kingdoms was the bloodiest period in the history of ancient China, thousands of people died in battles over who would sit in the highest seat in the palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Samfélag hermaura leggur að auki land undir fót og byggir sér bú á mismunandi tímabilum. Á flökkutímabilinu þramma maurar að næturlagi og koma sér upp búi yfir daginn. Nýlendan fór á hirðingjastig þegar minna var orðið af tiltækum matvælum. Á þessu stigi býr nýlendan til tímabundin hreiður sem breytast á hverjum degi. Hver þessara flökkuleiðangra stendur yfir í um það bil 17 daga.
mt: 17 days is the average lifespan of a termite colony.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Margir hrynjandi taktar í lífeðlisfræði og hegðun reiða sig oft mikið á innræna hringrás og framleiðslu þeirra með lífklukkum. Reglubundinn taktur, sem er ekki einfaldlega viðbrögð við ytri reglulegum vísbendingum, hefur verið skjalfestur hjá flestum lífverum, þar með töldum bakteríum, sveppum, plöntum og dýrum. Lífsklukkur eru sjálfstæðar sveiflur sem halda áfram reglubundnum takti jafnvel án ytra áreitis.
mt: Many rhythmic patterns in biology and behavior often synchronize themselves to an internal clock and its production of circadian rhythms. The regular rhythm, which is not simply a response to external regular cues, has been established in most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants and animals. Circadian rhythms are self-sustaining oscillations that continue at a regular pace even without external input.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Dýrastofn er samsafn lífvera af tiltekinni dýrategund á tilteknu landsvæði. Þegar allir einstaklingar í þýði eru eins þegar kemur að einni svipgerð, eru þeir sagðir eingerðir. Þegar einstaklingarnir sýna nokkur afbrigði tiltekins eðlisþáttar eru þeir margbreytilegir.
mt: A zoo is a collection of animals of a particular type kept in a park, garden, or other place where the public has access. When all individuals in a species are alike when it comes to one particular trait, they are said to be uniform. When individuals show some variation in a particular trait, they are said to be diverse.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Náttúrutengd ferðaþjónusta heillar fólk sem hefur áhuga á að heimsækja náttúrusvæði með það að markmiði að njóta náttúrunnar, þar á meðal dýra- og gróðurlífs. Dæmi um dægrastyttingu á staðnum eru m.a. skotveiði, stangveiði, ljósmyndun, fuglaskoðun og heimsóknir í skrúðgarða og læra eitthvað nýtt um vistkerfið. Dæmi um slíkt er að ferðast, taka ljósmyndir og læra meira um órangútana á Borneó.
mt: Ecotourism is a form of tourism involving responsible travel, natural environmental and cultural heritage education, and volunteerism. Ecotourism focuses on creating value for local communities, minimizing impact on environments, and helping conservation. Ecotourists typically visit pristine areas, such as national parks, or places considered as being unspoiled by humans. In addition to visiting such areas, ecotourists are also interested in preserving the natural environment, and may be willing to pay for doing so. Ecotourism often focuses on restoring areas to their natural state, and restoring areas that have been previously damaged by tourism or industry.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Á hverjum morgni keyrir fólk í vinnuna úr litlum úthverfabæjum og mætir öðrum sem voru að yfirgefa vinnustaðinn. Í þessari kraftmiklu flutningsskutlu eru allir á einhvern hátt tengdir við og styðja, flutningskerfi sem byggir á einkabílum. Vísindin benda nú til þess að þetta gríðarmikla kolefnishagkerfi hafi losað lífhvolfið frá einu af stöðugu ástandi sínu sem hefur stutt þróun manna undanfarnar tvær milljónir ára.
mt: Every morning, people drive to work from small suburban homes and meet others who are leaving the workplace. In this massive transportation system, everyone is in some way connected to and supported by a car-based system that has released the human race from one of its stable states of development, which has lasted for the past two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Líta má á atómið sem eitt af grunnfrumeiningum alls efnis. Þetta er mjög flókin eining sem, samkvæmt einfölduðu Bohr-líkani, samanstendur af miðkjarna sem rafeindir sveima í kring, svipað og plánetur á sporbaug um jörðina – sjá skýringarmynd 1.1. Kjarninn er myndaður af tveimur ögnum , nifteindum og róteindum. Róteindir eru með jákvæða rafhleðslu en nifteindir eru með enga hleðslu. Rafeindirnar eru með neikvæða rafhleðslu.
mt: 1.1 Atoms are the fundamental building blocks of all matter. This is a very complex entity, according to the simplified Bohr model, consisting of a nucleus surrounded by electrons, similar to a planet orbiting the Earth – see Figure 1.1. The nucleus is made up of two protons, neutrons and electrons. Neutrons have no charge. Electrons have negative charge. Electrons are negatively charged.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

mt: 1.1 Atoms are the fundamental building blocks of all matter. This is a very complex entity, according to the simplified Bohr model, consisting of a nucleus surrounded by electrons, similar to a planet orbiting the Earth – see Figure 1.1. The nucleus is made up of two protons, neutrons and electrons. Neutrons have no charge. Electrons have negative charge. Electrons are negatively charged.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Því sem næst allar tölvur sem notaðar eru í dag byggja á úrvinnslu upplýsinga sem kótaðar eru sem tvíundartölur. Tvíundartala getur einungis haft eitt af tveimur gildum, þ.e.a.s. 0 eða 1 og talað er um slíka tölustafi sem tvíundartölustafi, eða bita á tölvumáli.
mt: All computers used today are based on processing data that is represented as binary numbers. A binary number can only have one of two values, 0 or 1, and such a digit is called a binary digit, or bit, in computer terminology.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Blogg geta einnig stuðlað að bættri ritunarkunnáttu nemenda. Í upphafi er blogg nemenda oft fullt af lélegri málfræði og stafsetningu, en tilvist lesendahóps breytir því oftast nær. Þar sem nemendur eru oft þeir áhorfendur sem gagnrýna mest byrjar blogghöfundurinn á að leitast við að bæta skrifin til að forðast gagnrýni. Þegar nemendur blogga ""verða þeir að kynna sér betur umheiminn."" Krafan um að fjalla um áhugasvið lesenda hvetur nemendur til að vera sniðugir og áhugaverðir (Toto, 2004). Bloggskrif er leið til að stuðla að samstarfi og hvetja nemendur til að víkka námið langt út fyrir hefðbundinn skóladag. Ábyrg notkun á bloggi ""getur hvatt nemendur til gagnrýninnar hugsunar; nemendur geta notað efni á netinu til að bæði taka afstöðu til þess sem aðrir eru að skrifa og til að koma sínu eigin sjónarmiði á framfæri í ákveðnum málum (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "Blogs can also help improve students' writing skills. In the beginning, students' blogs are often full of poor grammar and spelling, but the presence of an audience often changes that. As students blog, they are forced to improve their writing to avoid criticism. When students blog, they are forced to become more familiar with the world around them." The demand to talk about the interests of readers encourages students to be interesting and relevant (Toto, 2004). Blog writing is a way to encourage collaboration and encourage students to expand their education beyond the traditional school day. "Responsible use of blogs can encourage students to think critically; students can use the material on the Internet to both take a stance on what others are writing and to bring their own point of view to the forefront on certain issues (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Fjarsamskipti gefa rými til umhugsunar áður en öðrum er svarað. Slíkt gerir nemendum kleift að vinna á eigin hraða og stjórna takti upplýsingagjafar við kennsluna. Þar að auki eru færri tímatakmarkanir fyrir hendi þegar boðið er upp á sveigjanlegri vinnutíma (Bremer, 1998) Netnotkun og notkun veraldarvefsins auðveldar nemendunum að hafa aðgang að upplýsingum hvenær sem er. Nemendur geta einnig sent spurningar til leiðbeinenda hvenær sem er dagsins og þeir fá svör tiltölulega fljótt, í stað þess að bíða eftir næsta fundi augliti til auglitis.
mt: 1. The Internet provides time for consideration before responding. This allows students to work at their own pace and control the pace of information delivery during instruction. There are fewer time constraints when offering flexible work time (Bremer, 1998). Internet access and use of the World Wide Web allows students to have access to information at any time. Students can also send questions to instructors at any time and they can get answers relatively quickly, instead of waiting for the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Hefðbundni miðaldakastalinn hefur löngum veitt hugmyndafluginu innblástur og töfrað fram myndir af burtreiðum, veislum og riddaraliði Arthur. Það er auðvelt að ímynda sér hljóðin og lyktina af bardögum háðum fyrir löngu síðan þegar staðið er innan um þúsund ára gamlar rústir, að nánast heyra í tölti hestanna á götusteinunum og finna lyktina af hræðslunni sem stígur upp úr dýflissunum. Á ímyndunaraflið sér samt stoð í raunveruleikanum? Hví voru kastalar yfirhöfuð byggðir? Hvernig var hönnun þeirra og smíði?
mt: The medieval castle has long been a source of inspiration and fodder for the imagination, conjuring up images of banquets, tournaments and the knights of King Arthur. It is easy to imagine the sounds and smells of battles fought long ago when standing within a thousand years old ruins, almost hearing the hooves of the horses on the cobblestones and smelling the stench rising from the cesspits. Is there any truth in the imagination? Why were castles built on top of hills? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Dæmigert fyrir það tímabil er Kirby Muxloe Castle sem er frekar víggirt hús en raunverulegur kastali. Stóru gljáðu gluggarnir og þunnu veggirnir hefðu ekki getað staðist stórárás í langan tíma. Árið 1480, þegar Hastings lávarður hóf byggingarframkvæmdirnar, ríkti friður í nánast öllu landinu og aðeins var þörf á varnarmúrum gegn litlum ræningjahópum.
mt: For its time, Kirby Muxloe Castle was more of a fortified manor house than a real castle. The large glass windows and thin walls would not have stood up to a major assault for a long time. In 1480, when Hastings Lord began construction, there was peace in almost all the land and only needed defenses against small gangs of robbers.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Þegar hlaupið var lengt úr fjórðungi úr mílu í hálfa mílu varð hraðinn ekki nærri eins mikilivægari heldur var úthald algert lykilatriði. Að sjálfsögðu verður góður spretthlaupari, maður sem getur hlaupið á undir tveim mínútum, að búa yfir umtalsverðum hraða. Úthald verður þó alltaf að rækta. Víðavangshlaup á veturna ásamt vinnu fyrir efri hluta líkamans í líkamsrækt er er besti undirbúningurinn fyrir hlaupatímabilið.
mt: When you're in the fourth mile of a half marathon, the pace is not as critical as endurance. Of course, a good sprinter, someone who can run a sub-four-minute mile, will have a significant speed. Endurance will always be trained. Winter running and work for the upper part of the body in bodybuilding is the best preparation for the race period.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Réttar næringaraðferðir einar og sér veita ekki úrvalsframmistöðu. Þær geta samt haft veruleg áhrif á heildarvellíðan ungra íþróttamanna. Að viðhalda heilbrigðu orkujafnvægi, stunda árangursríkar vötnunarvenjur og skilja ýmsa þætti fæðubótaefna getur hjálpað íþróttamönnum að bæta frammistöðu sína og auka ánægju þeirra af íþróttinni.
mt: Only and alone, nutrition practices do not provide competitive advantage. They can, however, have a significant impact on the overall well-being of young athletes. To maintain a healthy energy balance, engage in successful hydration practices, and recognize various types of nutritional deficiencies can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Millvegalengdarhlaup er frekar ódýr íþróttagrein. Þó eru margar ranghugmyndir fyrir hendi varðandi þann litla búnað sem nauðsynlegur er til þátttöku. Hægt er að kaupa vörur eftir þörfum, en flestar hafa lítil sem engin raunveruleg áhrif á frammistöðuna. Íþróttafólk gæti kosið eina vöru umfram aðrar jafnvel þótt enginn sérstakur ávinningur felist í henni.
mt: 100m is a relatively inexpensive sport. However, there are many misconceptions about the little equipment needed to participate. Items can be purchased based on needs, but most have little to no effect on performance. Athletes could choose one item over others even though no particular advantage is associated with it.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: Segulómyndun byggist á eðlisfræðilegu fyrirbæri sem kallast kjarnsegulómur (NMR) og uppgötvaðist á þriðja áratug síðustu aldar af Felix Bloch (starfaði við Stanford-háskóla) og Edward Purcell (frá Harvard-háskóla). Við ómunina valda segulsvið og útvarpsbylgjur því að atóm gefa frá sér örlítil radíómerki. Árið 1970 uppgötvaði Raymond Damatian, læknir og rannsakandi, undirstöðuatriðin við að nota segulómun við læknisfræðilega greiningu. Fjórum árum síðar var veitt einkaleyfi, sem var fyrsta einkaleyfið í heiminum sem gefið var út á sviði segulómunar. Árið 1977 lauk Dr. Damadian við smíði fyrsta segulómstækisins fyrir „allan líkamann“ sem hann nefndi hið „Ósigranlega“.
mt: The concept of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) and was discovered in the 1940s by Felix Bloch (who worked at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). When atoms are excited, they emit radio waves because atoms emit tiny radio markers. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a physician and researcher, discovered the underlying principle of using NMR in medical diagnosis. Four years later, he was granted a patent, which was the first patent in the world issued in the field of magnetic resonance. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the first MRI machine for "the whole body" which he called the "Unisoluble".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Mannkynið hefur mestu hæfileika allra dýrategunda til að lesa hugsanir annarra. Þannig getum við með góðum hætti reynt að spá fyrir um hvað aðrir skynja, ætla sér, trúa á, vita eða þrá. Einn mikilvægasti hæfileikinn er að skilja ætlun annarra. Slíkur skilningur aðstoðar okkur við að leysa úr hugsanlegri tvíræðni við líkamlegar athafnir. Ef maður til dæmis sæi einhvern brjóta bílrúðu myndi maður líklega gera ráð fyrir að viðkomandi væri að reyna að stela bíl einhvers. Þú myndir líta öðruvísi á það ef hann hefði týnt bíllyklunum sínum og væri að reyna að brjótast inn í sinn eigin bíl.
mt: Humans have the greatest ability of all animal species to read the minds of others. Thus we can with good reason try to predict what others perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. The most important ability is to understand the intentions of others. Such understanding helps us to solve possible ambiguities with physical actions. If you see someone breaking a car window you would likely assume that the person is trying to steal a car. You would look differently at it if he had lost his car keys and was trying to break into his own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Gervigreind hefur sterk tengsl við vísindaskáldskap, en gervigreind er í reynd mjög mikilvæg grein innan tölvuvísindanna og fæst við hegðun, nám og snjalla aðlögun véla. Rannsóknir á sviði gervigreindar fela í sér smíði véla til að gera verk sem krefjast vitrænnar hegðunar, sjálfvirk. Dæmi um það er stýring, áætlanagerð og verkröðun, getan til að svara greiningum og spurningum viðskiptavina, auk rithandar-, radd- og andlitskennsla. Slíkir hlutir eru orðnar aðskildar greinar þar sem áhersla er lögð á að skapa lausnir á raunverulegum vandamálum. Gervigreindarkerfið er nú oft notað á sviði hagfræði, læknisfræði, verkfræði og hersins en það hefur verið smíðað í mörgum forritum í heimilistölvum og tölvuleikjum.
mt: Artificial intelligence has strong ties to science fiction, but artificial intelligence is actually a very important field within computer science and deals with behavior, learning and adaptive systems. Research in the field of artificial intelligence involves creating systems that can perform tasks that require intelligent behavior, such as planning, scheduling and control, to answer queries and questions from customers, as well as handwriting, speech and facial recognition. These areas have become separate fields where emphasis is placed on creating solutions to real-world problems. Artificial intelligence systems are now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, but it has been created in many programs in home computers and video games.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Mynstur samleitinnar hugsunar eru aðferðir til að leysa úr vandamálum þar sem saman koma ólíkar hugmyndir eða svið við úrlausn. Þungamiðjan í þessu hugarfari er hraði, rökfræði og nákvæmni, einnig að bera kennsl á staðreyndir, beita aftur núverandi tækni, söfnun upplýsinga. Mikilvægasti hluti hugarfarsins er eftirfarandi: bara eitt svar er rétt. Þú hugsar hins vegar aðeins um tvö svör, rétt og rangt svar. Þessi tegund hugsunnar er tengd ákveðnum vísindum eða stöðluðum verklagsreglum. Fólk með þessa tegund hugsunar býr yfir rökréttri hugsun, er fært um að leggja á minnið mynstur, leysa vandamál og vinna að vísindalegum rannsóknum.
mt: Mistakes in reasoning are methods to solve problems where different ideas or fields come together. The main focus in this field is speed, logic and accuracy, as well as to refer to actual facts, to apply current technology, to collect information. The most important part of this field is the following: only one answer is correct. However, you only think of two answers, correct and incorrect. This type of thinking is related to certain sciences or established rules of conduct. People with this type of thinking have a logical thinking, are trained to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific research.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Notkun á myndbandsupptökum hefur orsakað mikilvægar uppgötvanir við túlkun örtjáninga, andlitshreyfinga sem endast í nokkrar millisekúndur. Komið hefur fram sú kenning að hægt sé að greina hvort einstaklingur er að ljúga með því að túlka minnstu svipbrigði á réttan hátt. Oliver Sacks, í blaðinu The President‘s Speech, benti á það hvernig fólk sem er ófært um að skilja tal vegna heilaskaða er engu að síður fært um að meta einlægni með nákvæmum hætti. Hann stingur meira að segja upp á að slík færni í að túlka mannlega hegðun sé nokkuð sem dýr eins og hundar búi líka yfir.
mt: The use of video recordings has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of microexpressions, facial expressions that last only a few milliseconds. It has been found that people can detect whether someone is lying by interpreting the slightest nuances correctly. Oliver Sacks, in the article The President's Speech, points out how people who are unable to understand speech due to brain damage are still able to judge sincerity with great accuracy. He goes on to say that such ability to interpret human behavior is like that of dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Þar sem leiðin til að verða sér úti um þekkingu og menntun breyttist með þessum hætti eins og minnst var á hér á undan breyttist grunnforsendan fyrir því hvernig þekkingar var aflað. Aðferðin við upplýsingaöflun var önnur. Ekki var lengur þrýstingur á að framkvæma einstaka minningu heldur var getan til að muna texta meira í brennidepli. Í meginatriðum leiddi endurreisnin til umtalsverðra breytinga á nálgun að námi og miðlun þekkingar.
mt: As the ways of becoming educated and educated changed as described above, the basic premise for how knowledge was acquired changed. The method of information acquisition was different. There was no longer pressure to memorize one fact at a time but it was possible to remember more text in a flash. In the main, the renaissance led to significant changes in the approach to education and the dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Netið sameinar þætti bæði fjölmiðlunar og persónulegra samskipta. Sérkenni Netsins skapaði viðbótarvídd varðandi nýtni og fullnægjandi nálgun. Til dæmis er bent á „þekkingaröflun“ og „félagsleg samskipti“ sem mikilvægan hvata internetnotkunar (James o.fl., 1995). „Persónuleg þátttaka“ og „áframhaldandi sambönd“ voru einnig skilgreind sem nýir hvetjandi þættir af Eighmey og McCord (1998) þegar þeir rannsökuðu viðbrögð áhorfenda við vefsíðum.
mt: The internet unites both media and personal communication. The distinctive feature of the Internet creates additional dimensions of use and satisfactory approach. For example, "knowledge discovery" and "social interaction" are considered as an important incentive for Internet use (James et al., 1995). "Personal involvement" and "continuing relationships" were also defined as new motivating factors by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they studied the responses of visitors to websites.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gotneski stíllinn náði toppi á tímabilinu frá 10.-11. öld og 14. aldar. Í upphafi var klæðnaður undir töluverðum áhrifum af býsanskri menningu í austri. Stílbrigði á Vesturlöndum kunna hins vegar að vera um 25 til 30 ár eftir á vegna þess hve samskiptin ganga hægt fyrir sig. við lok miðalda fór vestur Evrópa að þróa sinn eigin stíl. eitt stærsta skrefið sem til kom vegna krossferðanna var að fólk fór að festa saman fatnað með hnöppum.
mt: 10th and 11th century Gothic style reached its peak in the 14th century. In the beginning, the clothing was under significant influence from Byzantine culture in the east. However, the style in the west can be about 25 to 30 years later due to the time it takes for communication to take place. At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the biggest steps that came about due to the Crusades was that people began to fasten clothing with buttons.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Það er hægt að vera vinsamlegri gagnvart umhverfinu, gerast þátttakandi í umhverfishreyfingunni og jafnvel vera aðgerðasinni til að draga úr eymd framtíðarinnar að einhverju marki. Þetta er eins og meðferð við einkennum í mörgum tilfellum. Ef við viljum samt ekki tímabundna lausn, þá ættum við að leita að rót vandans og óvirkja hana. Það er nokkuð augljóst að heimurinn hefur breyst mikið vegna framþróunar mannkynsins í vísindum og tækni, en vaxandi vandamál eru til staðar vegna offjölgunar og óhófsamra lifnaðarhátta mannkynsins.
mt: It is possible to be more friendly to the environment, participate in environmental activities and even be an activist to reduce the impact of the future to some extent. This is like treating symptoms in many cases. If we do not want a temporary solution, we should look for the root of the problem and neutralize it. It is quite obvious that the world has changed a lot due to the development of mankind in science and technology, but growing problems are present due to overpopulation and unsustainable lifestyles of mankind.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Valdajafnvægi var kerfi þar sem Evrópuþjóðir reyndu að viðhalda fullveldi allra Evrópuríkja. Yfirvöld breyttu oft bandalögum sínum svo að hægt væri að halda jafnvæginu við. Þetta var gert því Evrópuþjóðir vildu hindra að ein þjóð yrði valdamikil. Spænska erfðastríðið var það fyrsta þar sem lykilatriðið var valdajafnvægi. Þetta hafði í för með sér þýðingarmikla breytingu því Evrópuþjóðir litu ekki lengur út fyrir að vera í trúarstríði. Þannig varð 30 ára stríðið það síðasta sem nefnt var trúarbragðastríð.
mt: The balance of power was a system in which European nations tried to maintain the sovereignty of all European nations. The governments often changed their treaties so that it was possible to maintain the balance of power. This was done because European nations no longer looked out to be in a religious war. Thus, the 30-year war was the last to be called a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Á þessu tímabili í evrópskri sögu var farið að líta kaþólsku kirkjuna, sem hafði safnað að sér auði og völdum, gagnrýnni augum. Í yfir þúsund ár hafði Kristnitrú bundið Evrópuríki saman þrátt fyrir ólík tungumál og siði. Alvald hennar hafði áhrif á alla, allt frá kóngi til almúgamanna. Ein helsta kenning kristinna manna er að auðæfi eigi að nota til að draga úr þjáningum og fátækt og að peningasjóðir kirkjunnar séu til staðar einkum vegna þess. Miðlægt yfirvald kirkjunnar hafði verið við völd í Róm í yfir þúsund ár og samþjöppunin á valdi og auði hafði það í för með sér efasemdir margra um hvort þessum kennisetningum væri fullnægt.
mt: At this time in European history, the Catholic Church, which had amassed wealth and power, was being looked at with critical eyes. For over a thousand years, Christianity had bound Europe together despite different languages and customs. Its influence had reached all the way from king to peasant. One of the main tenets of Christian doctrine is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that church funds are there for that purpose. The middle ages had seen the church's influence in Rome for over a thousand years and the separation of power and wealth had raised doubts in many as to whether these tenets were being fulfilled.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Hinn dauðhræddi konungur Louis XVI, drottningin Marie Antoinette, tvö ung börn þeirra (11 ára Marie Therese og fjögurra ára Louis-Charles) og systir konungs, frú Elizabeth,  voru þann 6. október árið 1789 neydd af hóp af æstum markaðskonum, til að snúa aftur til Parísar. Þau snéru aftur til Parísar í hestakerru og voru umkringd múg sem öskraði og kallaði hótanir gegn kónginum og drottningunni. Mannfjöldinn þvingaði kóng og drottningu til að hafa vagngluggana alveg opna. Einn úr múgnum sveiflaði afskornu höfði af einum úr lífvarðasveit konungsins, sem var drepinn í Versölum, fyrir framan skelfingu lostna drottninguna.
mt: King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (11-year-old Marie Therese and four-year-old Louis-Charles) and the king's sister, Madame Elizabeth, were forced by a mob of wealthy merchants, on October 6, 1789, to return to Paris. They returned to Paris in a horse-drawn carriage and were surrounded by a mob that hissed and shouted threats against the king and queen. The crowd forced the king and queen to have the carriage windows completely open. One of the mob slapped the face of one of the queen's attendants, who was killed in Versailles, in front of the terrified queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Stuttu eftir að stríðsátök brutust út setti Bretland Þýskaland í herkví. Stefnan reyndist árangursrík og stöðvaði lífsnauðsynlegar hernaðar- og borgarabirgðir, þó að þessi herkví bryti í bága við almennt viðurkennd alþjóðalög sem staðfest voru með nokkrum alþjóðasamningum síðustu tvær aldir. Bretland dreifði tundurduflum á alþjóðlegu hafsvæði til að koma í veg fyrir skipaferðir inn á stór hafsvæði, sem olli jafnvel hlutlausum skipum mikilli hættu. Þýskaland átti von á svipuðum viðbrögðum við ótakmörkuðum stríðsrekstri kafbáta því viðbrögðin voru takmörkuð við þessu bragði.
mt: After the outbreak of war, Britain imposed a naval blockade on Germany, which proved successful in stopping vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade was in violation of generally accepted international law, which had been established by several international treaties in the last two decades. Britain also deployed mines in international waters to prevent ships from entering the main sea lanes, which even caused innocent ships great danger. Germany hoped for similar responses to unrestricted submarine warfare, as the blockade was restricted to this type of attack.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Innan Bandaríkjanna eru u.þ.b. 400.000 þekkt tilfelli heila- og mænusiggs (MS) og er MS helsti taugasjúkdómur sem hrjáir yngri og miðaldra fullorðna. MS er sjúkdómur sem hefur áhrif á miðtaugakerfið sem samanstendur af heilanum, mænunni og sjóntauginni. Rannsóknir hafa leitt í ljós að konur eru tvisvar sinnum líklegri til að fá MS en karlar.
mt: 400,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) are known in the United States, and MS is the leading cause of neurological disability in young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which consists of the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerves. Research has shown that women are twice as likely to get MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Rannsóknin sýndi að þunglyndi, ótti og stórslys sköpuðu tengingu á milli sársauka fötlunar hjá þeim sem þjást af mjóbakverkjum. Áhrif hörmunga, ekki þunglyndis og ótta voru skilyrt við reglubundna, vikulega hreyfingu. Þeir sem tóku þátt í reglulegri hreyfingu þurftu meiri stuðning hvað varðar neikvæða skynjun sársauka og við að greina muninn á langvarandi verkjum og óþægindum frá eðlilegri hreyfingu.
mt: The study showed that depression, fear and major life events were associated with increased risk of injury among those with mental illness. The effects of noise, not depression and fear were associated with regular, weekly exercise. Those who participated in regular exercise needed more support in recognizing negative symptoms and in distinguishing between long-term work and normal exercise.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Nútímaskylmingar eru leiknar á mörgum stigum, allt frá nemendum sem læra í háskóla til atvinnu- og ólympíukeppni. Íþróttin fer aðallega fram á milli tveggja, einn skylmingarmaður berst við annan.
mt: The sport is played between two teams, one player from each team competing at a time.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Innvortis eitrun kemur ekki alltaf strax í ljós. Einkenni eins og uppköst eru mjög almenn og því getur sjúkdómsgreining ekki átt sér stað strax. Bestu merkin um innvortis eitrun getur verið tilvist opins íláts með lyfjum eða eitruðum efnum til heimilisnota. Athugaðu hvort merkingar innihaldi leiðbeiningar um skyndihjálp vegna þessa tiltekna eiturs.
mt: Internal bleeding may not always be immediately apparent. Symptoms such as nausea are very common and thus a diagnosis cannot be made immediately. The best signs of internal bleeding may be the presence of open wounds with medications or drugs for home use. Check if the symptoms include instructions for emergency help due to this specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Til að huga að fórnarlambinu verður að skoða aðstæður fyrst til að tryggja eigið öryggi. Nauðsynlegt er að taka eftir stöðu fórnarlambsins þegar nær kemur sem og öll sjálfvirk viðvörunarmerki. Ef þú meiðir þig við að veita aðstoð gerir þú bara illt verra.
mt: To approach the victim, first ensure your own safety. It is necessary to check the status of the victim and all automatic safety signs. If you are injured while trying to help, you are only making it worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Mikið af félagslegum og pólitískum áhrifum eru fyrir hendi eins og til dæmis notkun metrakerfis, breyting frá alræðris- til lýðræðisstjórnarfars, þjóðernishyggju og þeirri trú að landið tilheyri þjóðinni en ekki einum einasta þjóðhöfðingja. Eftir byltinguna voru störf í boði fyrir karlkyns umsækjendur og þeir metnaðarfyllstu og öflugustu náðu mestum árangri. Sama gildir um herinn vegna þess að í stað þess að herflokkun sé byggð á stétt var hún nú byggð á hlaupvídd. Franska byltingin hvatti einnig margt annað kúgað verkalýðsfólk í öðru landi til að hefja sínar eigin byltingar.
mt: There are many social and political ramifications, such as the adoption of the metric system, the transition from autocracy to democracy, nationalism, and the belief that the country belongs to the people and not to one individual. After the revolution, jobs were open to male applicants and the most qualified and most able achieved the greatest success. The same is true of the army, as instead of being based on class, it was now based on ability. The French Revolution also inspired many other oppressed people to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Allir taka þátt í samfélagi og nota samgöngukerfi. Nánast allir kvarta undan samgöngukerfum. Í þróunarlöndunum er sjaldan kvartað eins mikið undan vatnsgæðum eða brúm sem eru að hruni komnar. Af hverju leiða flutningakerfi af sér slíkar kvartanir, af hverju bregðast þau daglega? Eru verkfræðingarnir bara vanhæfir? Eða er einhverju grundvallartriði um að kenna?
mt: 99.9% of people use public transportation. 99.9% of people complain about public transportation. In developing countries, it is rare to complain as much about water or bridge infrastructure that is collapsing. Why do transportation systems cause such complaints, why do they fail so often? Are engineers just incompetent? Or is there some fundamental principle about teaching?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Umferðarstreymi er rannsókn á ferðum einstakra ökumanna og ökutækja á milli tveggja staða og hver áhrif þeirra eru hver á annan. Því miður er erfitt að rannsaka streymi umferðar því ekki er hægt að segja fyrir um hegðun ökumanna með vissu. Sem betur fer hegða ökumenn sér almennt innan eðlilegra marka. Þar af leiðandi er ákveðið samræmi á umferðarstraumum sem hægt er að sýna í grófum dráttum með stærðfræðilegum útreikningum. Tiil að lýsa betur flæði umferðar hafa verið skilgreind tengsl á milli þriggja helstu eiginleika umferðar: (1) flæði, (2) þéttleiki og (3) hraði. Þessi sambönd hjálpa til við skipulagningu, hönnun og rekstur akbrautaraðstöðu.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the movement of individual vehicles and people on roads and highways. The movement of vehicles is usually represented using a traffic model. Traffic flow is usually represented as the rate of flow (vehicles per hour or per day), the concentration (number of vehicles per unit of road space) and the speed (distance per unit of time). These three characteristics are related by the equation q = kρv, where q is the rate of flow, k is a constant, ρ is the concentration and v is the speed. This equation is known as the Greenshields model. The equation is only valid for low concentrations of traffic, and is not valid for high concentrations of traffic. The equation is also known as the Greenshields equation, the Greenshields relation or the Greenshields formula.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

These three characteristics are related by the equation q = kρv, where q is the rate of flow, k is a constant, ρ is the concentration and v is the speed. This equation is known as the Greenshields model. The equation is only valid for low concentrations of traffic, and is not valid for high concentrations of traffic. The equation is also known as the Greenshields equation, the Greenshields relation or the Greenshields formula.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Tilraun Hershey og Chase var ein af leiðandi tillögum þess efnis að DNA væri erfðaefni. Hershey og Chase notuðu fögur eða veirur til að skeyta þeirra eigin DNA saman við bakteríu. Þeir gerðu tvær tilraunir sem merktu annað hvort DNA í veirunni með geislavirkum fosfór eða prótíni veirunnar með geislavirkum brennisteini.
mt: Hershey and Chase's experiment was one of the leading arguments that DNA was the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages to infect bacteria. They performed two experiments that either marked the DNA in the phage with radioactive phosphorus or the protein in the phage with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Stökkbreytingar geta haft margvísleg áhrif háð tegund stökkbreytinga, mikilvægi erfðaefnisins verður fyrir áhrifum og hvort frumurnar sem verða fyrir áhrifum eru kímlínufrumur. Stökkbreytingar í kímlínufrumum geta einar borist í börn en stökkbreytingar annars staðar geta valdið frumudauða eða krabbameini.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected gene, and whether the affected cells are stem cells. Mutations in stem cells can be passed on to offspring, while mutations elsewhere can cause cancer or cell death.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Geitur virðast hafa verið tamdar fyrir á að giska 10.000 árum í Zagros-fjöllunum í Íran. Fornmenning og þjóðflokkar hófu geymslu á slíku til að auðvelda aðgengi að mjólk, hári, kjöti og húðum. Tömdum geitum var yfirleitt haldið í hjörðum sem ráfuðu um hæðir eða önnur beitilönd, oft og tíðum gætt af geitahirðum, sem voru oftar en ekki börn eða unglingar, svipað og hinir betur þekktu fjárhirðar. Þessum aðferðum er enn beitt í dag.
mt: 10,000 years ago, goats were domesticated in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient peoples and ethnic groups stored such animals to facilitate access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domesticated goats were usually kept in pens that fenced off heights or other grazing lands, often guarded by goat herders, who were often children or young people, similar to the better known sheep herders. These methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf er leikur þar sem kylfingar nota kylfur til að hitta bolta í holu. Átján holur eru spilaðar í venjulegri keppni, þar sem kylfingar hefja yfirleitt leik á fyrstu holu vallarins og enda á þeirri átjándu. Sá leikmaður sem slær sjaldnast, eða sveiflar kylfunni sjaldnast, til að ljúka hringnum vinnur. Leikurinn er spilaður á grasi og grasið í kringum holuna er slegið styttra og það er kallað flöt.
mt: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played in a regular match, where players typically start play on the first hole of the front nine and end on the eighteenth. The player who hits the ball the fewest times, or swings the club the fewest times, to complete a round of play wins. The game is played on grass and the grass around the hole is cut shorter and is called the fairway.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Meginmarkmið vísindanna er að átta sig á því hvernig heimurinn virkar með vísindalegri nálgun. Þessi aðferð stýrir í raun flestum vísindarannsóknum. Þetta er ekki eina markmiðið vegna þess að tilraunir, eða prófanir til að afsanna eina eða fleiri hugsanlegar getgátur, spyrja spurninga og gera athuganir eru einnig leiðarstef vísindarannsókna.
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the universe works using the scientific method. This is not the only goal because experiments, or tests to disprove one or more possible hypotheses, asking questions and making observations are also the goals of science.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Skýstrókar fara um smærra svæði en aðrir ofsastormar, en þeir eyðileggja allt sem verður á vegi þeirra. Skýstrókar rífa tré upp með rótum, rífa klæðningu af húsum og kasta bílum upp í loftið. Tvö prósent öflugustu skýstrókanna geta enst í meira en þrjá tíma. Þetta illviðri er með vindstyrk við allt að 480 km/klst (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Tornadoes cover a smaller area than other storms, but they destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes rip trees up by the roots, rip clothing off houses and throw cars into the air. Two percent of the most powerful tornadoes can last more than three hours. This disaster is accompanied by wind speeds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Mannkynið hefur búið til og notað stækkunarlinsur í mörg þúsund ár. Hins vegar var byrjað að framleiða fyrstu alvöru sjónaukana í Evrópu á seinni hluta 16. aldar. Í þessum sjónaukum var notast við tvær linsur til að láta hluti í fjarlægð minnka og stækka.
mt: Humans have used magnifying lenses for thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were invented in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used two lenses to make distant objects appear smaller and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: "Múhameð hafði mikinn áhuga á málum utan þessa veraldlega lífs. Hann fór oft í helli, sem síðar var þekktur sem „Hira"" á fjallinu „Noor"" (ljós) til að hugleiða. Sjálfur hellirinn, sem stóðst tímans tönn, gefur skýra mynd af trúarlegum hneigðum Múhameðs. Hellirinn er á toppi eins af fjöllunum norður af Mekka og er alveg einangraður frá umheiminum. Reyndar er alls ekki auðvelt að finna hann, jafnvel þótt maður viti af honum. Þegar komið er inn í hellinn tekur við algjör einangrun. Ekkert er að sjá annan en heiðskýran og fallegan himinn og umhverfis eru mörg fjöll. Innan úr hellinum er lítið hægt að sjá af þeim heimi eða heyra."
mt: "Muhammad was very interested in matters outside this earthly life. He often went into a cave, later known as the "Hira" on the mountain "Noor" (light) to meditate. The cave itself, which stood the test of time, gives a clear picture of Muhammad's religious inclinations. The cave is on top of one of the mountains north of Mecca and is completely isolated from the outside world. It is actually not easy to find it, even though you know of it. When you enter the cave, you are completely isolated. Nothing is to be seen but the heavenly and beautiful sky and around are many mountains. Inside the cave, it is difficult to see or hear anything from that world."
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Vegir fyrir vagna voru lagðir á Englandi þegar á 16. öld. Vegir fyrir hestakerrur voru aðeins lagðir með samliggjandi borðum úr timbri, en hestar gátu samt sem áður dregið kerrurnar á meiri hraða og dregið þyngri farm en á hrjúfari vegum þess tíma. Farið var að nota þvertré frekar snemma til að halda teinunum á sínum stað. En smám saman kom í ljós að nýting teinanna yrði betri ef þeir væru með járn á toppnum. Þetta var alvanalegt, en járnið olli meiri sliti á tréhjólum vagnanna. Um síðir var viðarhjólum skipt út fyrir járnhjól. Árið 1767 komu fyrstu járnteinarnir til sögunnar.
mt: 16th century roads in England were paved with wooden planks. Horses could still pull the wagons at a faster speed and pull heavier loads than on dirt roads of the time. It was soon discovered that the use of the cross-ties would be better if they were made of iron. This was a breakthrough, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually wooden wheels were replaced with iron wheels. In 1767 the first iron rails appeared.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: Rómantíkin átti stóran þátt í menningarlöghyggju sem fengin er frá rithöfundum eins og Goethe, Fichte og Schlegel. Samkvæmt rómantísku stefnunni mótaði landið einstaklingana og með tíð og tíma urðu til venjur og menning sem tengdust landinu og voru í samhljómi við þjóðfélagið og reyndust mun betur en lög sem sett voru af handahófi.
mt: Romanticism played a large part in the cultural history of the country, as seen in the works of writers such as Goethe, Fichte and Schlegel. According to the romanticist view, the country shaped the individual and over time, customs and culture developed that were in harmony with the nation and proved better than laws set by the government.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "Tæknileg löghyggja er hugmynd sem nær yfir ýmiss konar hugmyndir , allt frá tækniþrýstings eða tæknilegra skylduboða til öflugrar tilfinningar fyrir því að örlög manna ráðist af grundvallarrökfræði sem tengist vísindalögum og birtingarmynd þeirra í tækni. Flestar túlkanir á tæknilegri nauðhyggju deila tveimur almennum hugmyndum: Að þróun tækninnar sjálfar fylgi leið sem er að mestu leyti ekki bundin menningarlegum og pólitískum áhrifum og að tæknin hafi á sama hátt ""áhrif"" á samfélög sem eru eðlislæg, frekar en félagslega skilyrt. Til dæmis væri hægt að segja að bifreiðin leiði óhjákvæmilega til vegagerðar. Landsbundið vegakerfi er hins vegar ekki fjárhagslega hagkvæmt fyrir örfáa bíla þannig að nýjar framleiðsluaðferðir eru þróaðar til að draga úr kostnaði við bifreiðaeign. Fjöldaeign bíla leiðir einnig til hærri tíðni slysa á vegum, sem leiðir til þess að nýjar aðferðir í heilbrigðisþjónustu eru fundnar upp til að gera við tjasla fólki saman."
mt: "Technological determinism is a concept that encompasses a variety of ideas, ranging from technological imperative or technological determinism to powerful feelings about the way in which technological development is largely independent of cultural and political influences and that technology has "effects" on societies that are essentially natural, rather than socially constructed. For example, it could be said that the automobile inevitably led to road construction. However, a national road system is not economically feasible for a small number of cars, so new production methods are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Similarly, the proliferation of cars leads to increased traffic accidents, which leads to the development of new medical techniques to treat car crash victims."
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "Merkið fyrir ""uppstrok"" lítur út eins og V og merkið fyrir ""niðurstrok"" er eins og hefti eða ferningur sem á vantar botninn. Upp merkir að byrja skal efst og ýta boganum, en niður merkir að byrja skal við froskinn (þar sem höndin heldur í bogann) og toga í bogann. Yfirleitt heyrist mýkra hljóð þegar boganum er strokið upp á við en öflugra og skærara hljóð þegar boganum er strokið niður á við. Settu inn þínar eigin merkingar að vild, en hafðu í huga að prentuðu bogamerkin hafa tónlistarlegt gildi, svo yfirleitt ætti að taka tillit til þeirra."
mt: "The symbol for 'upstroke' looks like a V and the symbol for 'downstroke' is like a hook or a dot that is missing the bottom. Up means to start at the top and push the pen, while down means to start at the tip (where the hand holds the pen) and pull the pen. Usually a softer sound is heard when the pen is stroked up on the paper than when the pen is stroked down on the paper. Insert your own symbols if you wish, but keep in mind that printed pen strokes have musical value, so usually it is best to take into account those."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: "Merkið fyrir ""uppstrok"" lítur út eins og V og merkið fyrir ""niðurstrok"" er eins og hefti eða ferningur sem á vantar botninn.
