src: Drukgyal Dzong eru rústir af virki og búddaklaustur í efri hluta Paro-hverfisins (í Phondey-dal). Sögur segja að árið 1649 hafi Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel byggt virkið sem minnisvarða um sigur sinn á herliði Tíbeta og Mongóla. Árið 1951 urðu tilteknar menjar í Drukgyal Dzong eldsvoða að bráð, þar á meðal myndin af Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Virkið var gert upp eftir eldsvoðann og verndað og er í dag einn fjölsóttasti ferðamannastaður Bútan.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is the ruins of a fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper Paro valley (in Phondey valley). Stories say that in 1649 Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel built the fortress as a memorial to his victory over Tibetan and Mongolian armies. In 1951, the fortress was destroyed by fire, including the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. The fortress was rebuilt after the fire and is now one of the most popular tourist destinations in Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Á 18. öld var Kambódía aðþrengt milli tveggja valdamikilla nágranna, Taílands og Víetnams. Taílendingar gerðu innrás inn í Kambódíu nokkrum sinnum á 18. öld og árið 1772 eyðilögðu þeir Phnom Phen. Síðustu ár 18. aldar réðust Víetnamar einnig inn í Kambódíu.
mt: 18th century Cambodia was sandwiched between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century, Vietnam also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Upphaf Taívan má rekja aftur á 15. öld þegar evrópskir sjómenn sem áttu leið hjá skrásettu nafn eyjunnar sem Ilha Formosa, eða falleg eyja. Árið 1624 reisti Hollenska Austur-Indíafélagið búðir í suðvesturhluta Taívan og breytti framleiðsluhefðum innbyggja á hrísgrjónum og réð verkafólk frá Kína til að vinna á hrísgrjóna- og sykurreyrsplantekrum fyrirtækisins. Árið 1683 tók herlið Qing-keisaraveldisins (1644-1912) yfirráð yfir strandsvæði Vestur- og Norður-Taívan og gerði Taívan að héraði í Qing-keisaraveldinu árið 1885. Árið 1895, eftir ósigur í fyrsta stríðinu á milli Kína og Japan (1894-1895), skrifaði Quing-ríkisstjórnin undir Shimonoseki-samkomulagið og afsalaði sér yfirráðum Taívan til Japan sem réð yfir eyjunni til ársins 1945.
mt: The history of Taiwan can be traced back to the 15th century when European sailors who called the island Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a settlement in southwestern Taiwan and changed the production of rice and sugar crops of the island's inhabitants. In 1683, the Qing Empire (1644-1912) took control of the coastal areas of West and North Taiwan and made Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Shimonoseki Treaty and ceded Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Þetta er kallað pH efna. Þú getur búið til vísbendingu með safa úr rauðkáli. Kálsafinn breytir um lit eftir því hversu súrt eða basískt (alkalískt) efnið er. Sýrustigið er gefið til kynna með magni vetnisjóna (H-ið í pH) í prófunarefninu. Vetnisjónir eru róteindir sem hafa glatað rafeindum sínum (vegna þess að vetnisatóm eru með eina róteind og eina rafeind).
mt: This is called pH indicator. You can make a pH indicator by mixing red cabbage juice. The color of the cabbage juice changes depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the substance is. The acidity is indicated by the amount of hydronium ions (H+ in pH) in the test solution. Hydronium ions are ions that have lost their electrons (because hydrogen atoms are single ions with one electron and one proton).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Ljón eru félagslyndasta kattategundir og lifa í stórum hópum sem kallast ljónahjarðir. Hópar samanstanda af 1-3 fullorðnum karldýrum ásamt allt að 30 kvendýrum og ungum. Kvendýrin eru yfirleitt nátengd hvort öðrum, enda stór fjölskylda samansett af systrum og dætrum. Ljónahópar haga sér á svipaðan hátt og hópar úlfa eða hunda. Það eru dýr sem eru furðu lík ljónum (en ekki öðrum stórum köttum) í hegðun og einnig mjög banvæn í garð bráðar sinnar.
mt: Lions are the most social of cat species and live in large groups called prides. Groups are made up of 1-3 adult males along with up to 30 females and young. Females are usually related to each other, being sisters and daughters. Lions live in groups in much the same way as wolves or dogs. They are very similar to lions (but not other large cats) in behavior and are also very fond of their mothers.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Ljón eru félagslyndasta kattategundir og lifa í stórum hópum sem kallast ljónahjarðir. Hópar samanstanda af 1-3 fullorðnum karldýrum ásamt allt að 30 kvendýrum og ungum. Kvendýrin eru yfirleitt nátengd hvort öðrum, enda stór fjölskylda samansett af systrum og dætrum. Ljónahópar haga sér á svipaðan hátt og hópar úlfa eða hunda. Það eru dýr sem eru furðu lík ljónum (en ekki öðrum stórum köttum) í hegðun og einnig mjög banvæn í garð bráðar sinnar.
mt: Lions are the most social of cat species and live in large groups called prides. Groups are made up of 1-3 adult males along with up to 30 females and young. Females are usually related to each other, being sisters and daughters. Lions live in groups in much the same way as wolves or dogs. They are very similar to lions (but not other large cats) in behavior and are also very fond of their mothers.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Undir þeim eru fleiri miðlungsstórir kettir sem éta miðlungsstóra bráð allt frá kanínum til antilópa og dádýra. Svo eru til mörg lítil kattardýr (þ.m.t. kettir sem gæludýr) sem borða töluvert meira af litlum bráðum eins og skordýrum, nagdýrum, eðlum og fuglum. Leyndarmálið að baki velgengni þeirra er hugmyndin um kima, sérstakt verk sem hver köttur ber ábyrg á sem hindrar að hann keppir við aðra.
mt: Among them are many medium-sized cats that eat medium-sized prey from canines to antelopes and deer. There are many small cat species (such as cats that are predators) that feed on a large number of small prey such as insects, arachnids, rodents, and birds. The secret to their success is the idea of hunting, a unique work that each cat is responsible for that prevents it from competing with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Parduskettir éta gjarnan lítil dýr. Þeir veiða apa, snáka, nagdýr og fugla ef þeir ná þeim. Nánast öll dýr sem parduskettir veiða eru mun minni en þeir. Vísindamenn telja að parduskettir elti og finni dýr til að éta (bráð) með lykt og að þefa þar sem þau hafa gengið á jörðinni. Þeir eru með nætursjón og sjá mjög vel í myrkri og hreyfingar þeirra eru laumulegar. Parduskettir veiða bráð sína með því að falla inn í umhverfi sitt og gera síðan snögga árás á bráð sína.
mt: Pardus cats are known to eat small animals. They hunt monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can catch them. Almost all animals that pardus cats hunt are much smaller than they are. Scientists believe that pardus cats hunt and find animals to eat (prey) with scent and track where they have gone on the ground. They have night vision and see very well in darkness and their movements are stealthy. Pardus cats hunt their prey by entering their environment and then making a sudden attack on their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Alhliða líkamsbygging tígrisdýrs gerir því kleift að klifra (ekki sérlega vel samt), synda, hoppa langt og toga á við fimm hrausta menn. Tígrisdýrið er í sömu ættkvísl (Cenus Panthera) og ljón, hlébarðar og jagúar. Þessir fjórir kettir eru þeir einu sem geta öskrað. Öskur tígrisdýrsins er ekki eins og fullradda ljónsöskur, en minnir heldur meira á setningu með urrandi, hrópuðum orðum.
mt: The tiger's body shape allows it to climb (not very well though), jump long distances and drag five full-grown men. Tigers are in the same genus (Cenus Panthera) as lions, leopards and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones that can roar. The tiger's roar is not as loud as a full-grown lion's roar, but it sounds more like a growl with a rumbling, hoarse voice.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Fruma er minnsta byggingar- og starfræna eining lífvera (hluta). Fruma (e. cell) kemur frá latneska orðinu „cella“ sem merkir lítið herbergi. Ef þú skoðar lifandi hluti undir smásjá kemur í ljós að þeir eru samsettir úr litlum ferningum eða kúlum. Robert Hooke, líffræðingur frá Englandi, tók eftir litlum ferningum í korki með því að nota smásjá. Þau líktust herbergjum. Hann var fyrsti aðilinn sem skoðaði dauðar frumur.
mt: A cell is the smallest unit of structure and function in an organism (biological entity). Cell (biology) comes from the Latin word cella meaning small room. If you look at a living thing under a microscope, you can see that they are made up of small spheres or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, looked at small spheres in cork using a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to look at dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Dýr samanstanda af mörgum frumum. Þau borða hluti og melta innvortis. Flest dýr geta hreyft sig. Aðeins dýr hafa heila (en þó hafa ekki öll dýr hann, marglyttur eru til dæmis ekki með heila). Dýr fyrirfinnast um alla jörðu. Þau grafa sig niður í jörðina, synda í sjónum og fljúga um himininn.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They ingest food and digest it internally. Most animals can move. Only animals have blood (but not all animals have blood, moles are an example). Animals are found all over the Earth. They burrow into the ground, swim in the seas and fly through the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Plöntur mynda súrefni sem mennirnir anda að sér og þær taka í sig koltvísýring sem mennirnir anda út (anda því út). Plöntur skapa fæðu sína með því að nota sólina og ljóstillífun. Þær veita einnig skugga. Við byggjum híbýli okkar úr plöntum og gerum fötin úr plöntum. Megnið af matnum okkar er plöntur. Dýr gætu ekki lifað án plantna.
mt: Plants produce oxygen that we breathe in and take in carbon dioxide that we breathe out (breathe out). Plants create their food by using the sun and photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We build our homes from plants and make our furniture from plants. The majority of our food is plants. Animals could not live without plants.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Þegar lítill hópur lifandi vera (lítið þýði) skilst frá meginþýðinu sem þau komu úr (til dæmis ef þau fara yfir fjallgarð eða á, eða ef þau flytjast á aðra eyju þannig að erfitt verði að komast til baka) reynist umhverfið oft vera öðruvísin en þau voru í áður. Þetta nýja umhverfi er með aðrar auðlindir og keppinauta. Nýju íbúrarnir hafa því þörft á öðrum eiginleikum eða aðlögunhæfi til að vera sterkur keppinautur samanborið það sem áður var. Upprunalegir íbúar hafa ekkert breyst. Þeir hafa enn þörf á sömu aðlögun og áður. Með tímanum, þegar nýju íbúarnir fara að laga sig að nýja umhverfi sínu, fara þeir að líta minna og minna út eins og hinir íbúarnir. Að lokum, eftir þúsundir eða jafnvel milljónir ára, munu stofnarnir tveir vera orðnir svo frábrugðnir hvor öðrum að ekki verður lengur hægt að kalla þá sömu tegundina. Þetta er kallað tegundamyndun, en þýðir einfaldlegar að ný tegund verður til. Tegundamyndun er óhjákvæmileg afleiðing og mjög mikilvægur hluti þróunar.
mt: When a small group of individuals (a small number) are separated from the main group they came from (for example if they move over a mountain range or onto another island such that it is difficult to return) the environment they find themselves in is often different from what they were used to. This new environment has different resources and competitors. The new inhabitants therefore have a need for different traits or adaptability to be a strong competitor compared to what they were before. The original inhabitants have not changed. They still have the same need for adaptability as before. Over time, as the new inhabitants adapt to their new environment, they begin to look less and less like the other inhabitants. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two groups will be so different that it will no longer be possible to call them the same species. This is called speciation, or in simpler terms, a new species is created. Speciation is an unpredictable outcome and is a very important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Aðallíffæri blóðrásarkerfisins er hjartað sem dælir blóðinu. Blóð flæðir frá hjartanu í gegnum pípur sem kallast slagæðar og flæðir aftur til hjartans í pípum sem kallast bláæðar. Minnstu pípurnar eru kallaðar háræðar.
mt: The heart is the organ that pumps the blood. Blood flows from the heart through arteries and returns to the heart through veins. The smallest veins are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Aðallíffæri blóðrásarkerfisins er hjartað sem dælir blóðinu. Blóð flæðir frá hjartanu í gegnum pípur sem kallast slagæðar og flæðir aftur til hjartans í pípum sem kallast bláæðar. Minnstu pípurnar eru kallaðar háræðar.

src: Skordýr voru fyrstu dýrin sem gátu flogið. Þau notuðu flughæfni sína til að flýja óvini á auðveldan hátt og leita sér matar og maka á skilvirkari hátt. Flest skordýr búa yfir þeim hæfileika að geta brotið vænginn saman meðfram líkamanum. Þetta gefur þeim fjölbreyttari litla staði til að fela fyrir rándýrum. Núna eru einu skordýrin sem ekki geta lagt saman vængina drekaflugur og dægurflugur.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. They used their wings to fly away from predators easily and find food and mates more effectively. Most insects have the ability to break their wings along the body. This gives them a wider range of places to hide from predators. Now the only insects that cannot break their wings are dragonflies and damselflies.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Skordýr voru fyrstu dýrin sem gátu flogið. Þau notuðu flughæfni sína til að flýja óvini á auðveldan hátt og leita sér matar og maka á skilvirkari hátt. src: Margir steingervingafræðingar telja nú að einn hópur hafi liðað af. Sá dýrahópur kallast fuglar. Margir hugsa ekki um þá sem risaeðlur því að þeir eru með fjaðrir og geta flogið. En það er margt í fari fugla sem líkist enn risaeðlum. Fætur þeirra eru með hreistur og klær, þær verpa og nota báða afturfætur til að gang, rétt eins og T-Rex.
mt: Many paleontologists now believe that one group walked away. That dinosaur group is called birds. Many people don't think of them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there is much in birds that is like dinosaurs. Their feet have claws and scales, they lay eggs and use both hind feet to walk, just like T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Margir steingervingafræðingar telja nú að einn hópur hafi liðað af. Sá dýrahópur kallast fuglar. Margir hugsa ekki um þá sem risaeðlur því að þeir eru með fjaðrir og geta flogið. En það er margt í fari fugla sem líkist enn risaeðlum. Fætur þeirra eru með hreistur og klær, þær verpa og nota báða afturfætur til að gang, rétt eins og T-Rex.

But there is much in birds that is like dinosaurs. Their feet have claws and scales, they lay eggs and use both hind feet to walk, just like T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Tennur nashyrningseðlu gátu ekki bara rifið burt laufin heldur jafnvel þykkar greinar og rætur. Sumir vísindamenn telja að Triceratops hafi étið köngulpálma, en það er plöntutegund sem var algeng á krítartímabilinu. Þessar plöntur líta út eins og lítið pálmatré með kórónu af hvössum og göddóttum laufum. Nashyrningseðla gæti hafa notað sterkbyggðan gogginn til að fjarlægja laufblöðin áður en hún át trjábolinn. Aðrir vísindamenn vilja meina að þessar plöntur séu mjög eitraðar. Því er ólíklegt að risaeðlur hafi étið þær, þó að í dag geti letidýr og önnur dýr eins og páfagaukurinn (afkomandi risaeðlanna) étið eitruð lauf eða ávexti.
mt: The teeth of the Triceratops could not only shred leaves, but also thick stems and roots. Some scientists believe that the Triceratops ate palm trees, a plant that was common during the Cretaceous period. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of stiff and fleshy leaves. The Triceratops could have used its strong beak to remove the leaves before eating the tree. Other scientists want to deny that these plants are very poisonous. It is unlikely that these dinosaurs ate them, although today birds and other animals such as the peacock (descendant of the Triceratops) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Landslið Ítalíu í fótbolta, ásamt þýska landsliðinu, hefur náð öðrum besta árangri í heiminum meðal landsliða og Ítalía varð heimsmeistari í knattspyrnu árið 2006. Vinsælar íþróttir eru meðal annars fótbolti, körfubolti, blak, vatnapóló, skylmingar, rúgbý, hjólreiðar, íshokkí, hjólaskautahokkí og F1 kappakstur. Vetraríþróttir eru vinsælastar í norðurhéruðunum og Ítalir keppa á alþjóðlegum leikum og Ólympíuleikum.
mt: The Italian national football team, along with the German national football team, has achieved the best results in the world among national teams and Italy was world champion in football in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, baseball, water polo, volleyball, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and Formula 1 racing. Winter sports are most popular in the northern regions and Italians compete in international games and the Olympics.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Lúxemborg á sér langa sögu en ríkið hlaut sjálfstæði árið 1839. Núverandi svæði Belgíu tilheyrðu áður Lúxemborg en urðu belgísk eftir belgísku byltinguna á 4. áratug 19. aldar. Lúxemborg hefur alltaf reynt að vera hlutlaust land en það var hernumið bæði í fyrri heimsstyrjöldinni og síðari heimsstyrjöldinni af Þýskalandi. Árið 1957 gerðist Lúxemborg stofnaðili samtakanna sem í dag nefnast Evrópusambandið.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history but the country gained independence in 1839. The current area of Belgium belonged to Luxembourg before the Belgian Revolution of the 1830s. Luxembourg has always tried to be a neutral country but it was occupied by Germany in both World Wars. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Evrópski hluti Tyrklands (austurhluti Þrakíu eða Rúmelíu á Balkanskaganum) er 3% af landinu. Yfirráðasvæði Tyrklands er meira en 1.600 kílómetrar (1000 mílur) að lengd og 800 km (500 mílur) á breidd með nokkurn veginn rétthyrnda lögun. Stærð Tyrklands, að meðtöldum vötnum, er 783.562 ferkílómetrar, en af því eru 755.688 ferkílómetrar í suðvestur Asíu og 23.764 ferkílómetrar í Evrópu. Að flatarmáli er Tyrkland í 37. stærsta land heims, og er u.þ.b. jafnstórt og Frakkland og Bretland samanlagt. Tyrkland er með höf á þrjá vegu: að vestan Eyjahaf, að norðan Svartahaf og að sunnan Miðjarðarhaf.
mt: 3% of Turkey is in Europe. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometers (1,000 miles) long and 800 km (500 miles) wide with roughly rectangular shape. The size of Turkey, including lakes, is 783,562 square kilometers, of which 755,688 square kilometers are in southwestern Asia and 23,764 square kilometers in Europe. By area, Turkey is the 37th largest country in the world, and is roughly the same size as France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey has coasts on three seas: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Íbúar Vatikanborgar eru um 800. Það er minnsta sjálfstæða landið í heiminum og með minnstan fólksfjölda. Í Vaticanborg er notuð ítalska við lagasetningu og opinber samskipti. Ítalska er einnig daglegt mál hjá flestum sem starfa í ríkinu. Latína er notuð við trúarathafnir. Allir íbúar Vatíkansins eru kaþólskir.
mt: 800 people live in the Vatican City, the smallest independent country in the world and with the smallest population. Italian is used for legislation and public services. Italian is also the daily language of most people who work in the country. Latin is used in religious services. All citizens of the Vatican are Catholic.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Nú til dags eru tölvur notaðar til að hagræða myndum og myndböndum. Skapa má fágaðar hreyfimyndir í tölvum og þessi tegund af hreyfimynd er í auknum mæli notuð í sjónvarpi og kvikmyndum. Tónlist er oft tekin upp með vönduðum tölvum til að vinna úr og blanda saman hljóði.
mt: Computers are currently used to edit images and videos. Computer-generated motion pictures are increasingly used in movies and television. Music is often recorded with computers to manipulate and mix sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Borgirnar Harappa og Mohenjo-daro voru með salerni með vatni í næstum hverju húsi sem tengd voru við háþróað skólpkerfi. Rústir af skólpkerfum hafa fundist í byggingum mínósku borganna Krít og Santorini á Grikklandi. Einnig voru salerni til í Egyptalandi til forna, Persíu og Kína. Í rómverskri siðmenningu voru salerni stundum hluti af almenningsbaðhúsum þar sem karlar og konur voru blönduð saman.
mt: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had bathrooms with water in nearly every house connected to a sophisticated sewer system. Ruins of sewer systems have been found in the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. Bathrooms were also common in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, bathrooms were sometimes part of public bathhouses where men and women were mixed together.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Blað nútímaskauta er með tvöfaldri brún með íholu á milli. Brúnirnar tvær veita meira grip á ísnum, meira segja í halla. Vegna þess að neðsti hluti blaðsins er örlítið sveigður myndast einnig sveigja á yfirborð íssins sem blaðið er í snertingu við þegar það hallar á aðra hvora hliðina. Þetta veldur því að skautarinn þarf að snúa sér. Ef skautarnir halla til hægri, þá beygir skautarinn til hægri, ef skautarnir halla til vinstri, þá beygir skautarinn til vinstri.
mt: 2D ice skate blade has two convex curves between the two edges. The two convex curves provide more grip on the ice. Because the bottom part of the blade is slightly curved, a curve is also formed on the surface of the ice when the blade is in contact with it when it skates on the other side. This causes the skate to turn. If the skates skate to the right, the skate turns to the right, if the skates skate to the left, the skate turns to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Til að komast á fyrra orkustig verða þau að losna við aukaorkuna sem þau sóttu í ljósið. Þetta er gert með sendingu á örlitlum ljósögnum sem kallast „ljóseind“. Vísindamenn kalla þetta ferli ""örvaða losun geislunar"" vegna þess að frumeindir örvast af björtu ljósi, sem veldur losun á ljóseind ljóss og ljós er tegund geislunar. Næsta mynd sýnir atómin sem senda frá sér ljóseindir. Auðvitað eru ljóseindir í raun mun minni en þær á myndinni. Ljóseindir eru enn smærri en efnið sem myndar atóm!"
mt: "To get back to previous power levels, they will have to shed the excess power they have gained in the spotlight. This is done by sending out tiny photons called "photons". Scientists call this process "photon shedding" because the atoms of the elements are excited by bright light, causing the emission of photons and light is a type of photon. The next image shows the atoms that emit photons. Of course, photons are smaller than the atoms on the image. Photons are even smaller than the elements that form atoms!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: "Til að komast á fyrra orkustig verða þau að losna við aukaorkuna sem þau sóttu í ljósið. Þetta er gert með sendingu á örlitlum ljósögnum sem kallast „ljóseind“. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Eftir notkun í hundruðir klukkustunda brennur glóðarþráður ljósaperunnar upp og ljósaperan virkar ekki lengur. Síðan þarf að skipta um peruna. Nauðsynlegt er að fara varlega við skipti á perunni. Fyrst þarf að slökkva ljósið með rofanum eða taka snúruna úr sambandi. Þetta er vegna þess að rafmagn sem flæðir inn í innstunguna þar sem málmhluti peru situr getur gefið þér alvarlegt raflost ef þú snertir innstungu eða málmbotn perunnar meðan hún er enn að hluta til í innstungunni.
mt: After hundreds of hours of use, the filament of the LED bulb burns out and the LED bulb no longer works. Then you need to change the bulb. It is important to handle the bulb change carefully. First, turn off the light with the switch or disconnect the power cord. This is because the electricity that flows into the socket where the metal part of the bulb sits can give you a serious electric shock if you touch the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partially in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Klofnunarsprengjan virkar eftir þeirri meginreglu að það þarf orku til að setja saman kjarna með mörgum róteindum og nifteindum. Eins og að ýta þungri kerru upp hæð. Ef kjarninn er klofinn að nýju losnar eitthvað af þeirri orku. Sum atóm eru með óstöðugan kjarna og því hafa þau tilhneigingu til að brotna í sundur við lítinn eða engan núning.
mt: The fission bomb works according to the principle that it takes energy to put together nuclei with many protons and neutrons. Like pushing a heavy box up a hill. If the nucleus is split anew, something is released from that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei and thus have a tendency to break apart with little or no provocation.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Þegar hringt er í einhvern sem er þúsundir kílómetra í burtu er notað gervitungl. Geimgervihnötturinn tekur við símtalinu og endurkastar því nánast strax. Gervihnötturinn var sendur út í geiminn með eldflaug. Vísindamenn nota sjónauka í geimnum því að andrúmsloft jarðarinnar afmyndar ljós og útsýni okkar. Nota verður risastóra eldflaug sem er yfir 100 fet á hæð til að koma gervihnetti eða geimsjónauka út í geiminn.
mt: When you call someone thousands of miles away, a repeater is used. The repeater receives the call and almost immediately repeats it. The repeater was sent into space with a rocket. Scientists use a telescope in space because the Earth's atmosphere distorts light and our views. A large rocket that is over 100 feet tall will be used to launch a repeater or space telescope into space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Tíminn er allt umhverfis okkur og hefur áhrif á allt sem við gerum, þó er erfitt að skilja hann. Tíminn hefur verið rannsóknarefni fræðimanna á sviði trúarbragða, heimspeki og vísinda í árþúsundir. Við upplifum tímann sem röð atburða sem berast úr framtíðinn inn í nútíðina og aftur í fortíðina. Við notum tímann líka til að bera saman lengd atvika. Greina má hvernig tíminn líður með því að fylgjast með sveiflubundnum atburði. Sveiflubundinn atburður er það sem gerist reglulega aftur og aftur.
mt: Time is all around us and affects everything we do, though it is difficult to understand. Time has been a subject of research for scholars in the fields of religion, philosophy, and science for millennia. We experience time as a sequence of events passing from the future into the present and then into the past. We also use time to measure the duration of events. One can measure how time passes by tracking recurring events. A recurring event is one that happens regularly again and again.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Hefð er fyrir því að erfingi krúnunnar fari beint í herinn eftir að námi er lokið. Charles gekk hins vegar í háskólann við Trinity College í Cambridge þar sem hann lagði stund á mannfræði og fornleifafræði og síðar sagnfræði og lauk 2:2 prófi (lægri gráðu af öðrum flokki). Charles var fyrsti meðlimur bresku konungsfjölskyldunnar til að fá háskólagráðu.
mt: It is customary for the heir to the throne to join the military after finishing school. Charles, however, went to Trinity College at Cambridge University where he studied anthropology and archaeology and later history and graduated with a 2:2 degree (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British royal family to graduate from university.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: England upplifði langan friðartíma eftir endurupptöku Danalaga. Ethelred þurfti hins vegar að mæta víkingaflota árið 991 sem var stærri en nokkur annar floti frá því við Guthrum einni öld áður. Flotinn var undir forystu Olafs Trygvassonar, Norðmanns með metnað til að endurheimta land sitt frá yfirráðum Dana. Eftir hernaðarlegt afhroð náði Aðalráður samkomulagi við Ólaf sem snéri aftur til Noregs til að endurheimta konungsríki sitt, með misjöfnum árangri þó.
mt: England enjoyed a long period of peace after the re-conquest of the Danelaw. Ethelred however had to meet the Viking fleet of 991 which was larger than any other fleet since Guthrum's invasion a century earlier. The fleet was under the command of Olaf Tryggvason, a Norwegian with the intent to re-conquer his land from Danish rule. After a military truce, Aethelred agreed to terms with Olaf who returned to Norway to re-conquer his kingdom, with mixed results.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "Á 15. öld var norðanvert Eistland undir miklum menningarlegum áhrifum Þýskalands. Nokkrir þýskir munkar vildu færa Guð nær innfæddum og því fundu þeir upp eistnesku bókstafstunguna. Það var byggt á þýska stafrófinu og var einum staf, ""Õ/õ"", bætt við. Eftir því sem á leið runnu mörg tökuorð úr þýsku saman við málið. Þetta var upphafið að upplýsingarstefnunni."
mt: 15th century northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the natives and thus invented the Estonian alphabet. It was based on the German alphabet and one letter, "Õ/õ", was added. As time went on, many words of German origin were added to the language. This was the beginning of the Enlightenment.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Margar mismunandi ágiskanir eru til um hve margir tali hindí. Talið er að það sé annað til fjórða mest talaða tungumál í heimi. Fjöldi manns með tungumálið að móðurmáli er breytilegur eftir því hvort mjög nátengdar mállýskur eru taldar með eða ekki. Það eru frá 340 til 500 milljónum sem tala málið og allt að 800 milljónir skilja það. Hindí og úrdú hafa svipaðan orðaforða en ritmálin eru ólík; í venjulegum samræðum geta viðmælendur beggja tungumála yfirleitt skilið hvorn annan.
mt: There are many conflicting estimates of how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be the fourth most spoken language in the world. The number of people with Hindi as their mother tongue is variable depending on whether closely related dialects are counted or not. There are from 340 to 500 million speakers of the language and up to 800 million who understand it. Hindi and Urdu have similar vocabularies but different writing systems; in ordinary conversation, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "Hangeul er stafróf sem var sérstaklega búið til og það eina sem er notað að einhverju ráði í dag. Stafrófið var fundið upp árið 1444 í valdatíð Sejong konungs (1418-1450). Sejong konungur var fjórði konungur Joseon-keisaradæmisins og er einn af þeim virtustu. Upphaflega skírði hann Hangeul-stafrófið Hunmin Jeongeum, sem merkir ""réttu hljóðin fyrir leiðbeiningar handa fólkinu""."
mt: "Hangul is a writing system that was specifically created and is the only one used today. The writing system was invented in 1444 during the reign of Sejong the Great (1418-1450). Sejong the Great was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most respected. Originally, he named the Hangul writing system Hunmin Jeongeum, meaning "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people.""
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Margar kenningar eru fyrir hendi um uppruna sanskrít. Ein snýst um arískan flutning fólks í vesturátt til Indlands sem tók tungumálið sitt með sér. Sanskrít er fornt tungumál og er sambærilegt við rómanska tungumálið sem talað er í Evrópu. Fyrsta þekkta bók heimsins var skrifuð á sanskrít. Eftir safnverk Upanishads, dó sanskrít út sökum stigveldis. Sanskrít er mjög flókið og auðugt tungumál, sem hefur verið uppspretta margra indverskra nútímatungumála, rétt eins og latína er uppspretta evrópskra tungumála eins og frönsku og spænsku.
mt: Many theories are in place about the origin of Sanskrit. One revolves around the Aryan migration of people from west to India, which brought its language with it. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is similar to the Romance language spoken in Europe. The first known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the Upanishads collection, Sanskrit went extinct due to its decline. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has been the source of many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the source of European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Hvernig myndi aðdráttarafl Io toga í mig? Ef þú myndir standa á yfirborði Io myndir þú vega minna en á Jörðinni. Einstaklingur sem vegur 200 pund (90 kg) á jörðinni vegur um 36 pund (16 kg) á tunglinu Ió. Slíkt er auðvitað vegna þess að þyngdaraflið er minna.
mt: How would Io's gravity pull me in? If you could stand on Io's surface, you would weigh less than on Earth. A 200-pound (90-kilogram) person on Earth weighs about 36 pounds (16 kilograms) on Io. This is, of course, because the gravity is less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Yfirborð tunglsins samanstendur af steinum og ryki. Ysta lag tunglsins er kallað skorpa. Skorpan er um 70 km að þykkt á nærhliðinni og 100 km að þykkt á fjærhliðinni. Hún er þynnri undir tunglhafinu og þykkari undir hálendinu. Það getur verið meira af maríu nær því skorpan er þynnri. Auðveldara var fyrir hraunkviku að rísa upp á yfirborðið.
mt: The surface of the moon is made of rock and dust. The top layer of the moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the mare and thicker under the highlands. It may be more of a mare near the crust because it is thinner. It was easier to rise up to the surface during the lunar eclipse.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Yfirborð tunglsins samanstendur af steinum og ryki. Ysta lag tunglsins er kallað skorpa. Skorpan er um 70 km að þykkt á nærhliðinni og 100 km að þykkt á fjærhliðinni. Hún er þynnri undir tunglhafinu og þykkari undir hálendinu. Það getur verið meira af maríu nær því skorpan er þynnri. Auðveldara var fyrir hraunkviku að rísa upp á yfirborðið.
mt: The surface of the moon is made of rock and dust. The top layer of the moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the mare and thicker under the highlands. It may be more of a mare near the crust because it is thinner. It was easier to rise up to the surface during the lunar eclipse.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "Marga dreymir um þann dag þegar menn geta ferðast til annarrar stjörnu og kannað aðra heima. Sumir velta fyrir sér hvað sé þarna úti, sumir trúa að geimverur eða annað líf kunni að vera á annarri plánetu. En ef þetta gerist nokkurn tíma, þá líður örugglega mjög langt á milli. Stjörnurnar eru svo dreifðar að þær eru í trilljóna mílna fjarlægð frá ""nágrönnum"" sínum. Kannski munu barnabarnabörn þín dag einn standa í framandi heimi og velta fyrir sér fornum forfeðrum sínum?"
mt: "Many dream of the day when people can travel to other stars and explore other homes. Some imagine what is out there, some believe that aliens or other life could be on another planet. But if this ever happens, it will surely be a long time away. The stars are so scattered that they are trillions of miles away from their "neighbors". Maybe your great-great-grandchildren will stand in the future and wonder about their ancient ancestors?"
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Sólin er ekki með skorpu eins og jörðin sem þú getur staðið á. Öll sólin er gerð úr lofttegundum, eldi og plasma. Lofttegundin þynnist þegar lengra er farið frá miðju sólarinnar. Ytri hluti sólarinnar sem við sjáum er við horfum á hana kallast ljóshvolf, sem merkir „ljóskúla“.
mt: The sun is not a ball like the earth you can stand on. All the sun is made of gases, fire and plasma. The gases thin out the further away you get from the sun's center. The outer part of the sun we see is called the photosphere, which means "light sphere".
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Þrjú þúsund árum síðar, árið 1610, notaði ítalski stjörnufræðingurinn Galíleó Galílei sjónauka og komst að því að Venus hefur kvartil líkt og tunglið. Stig gerast vegna þess að aðeins hlið Venusar (eða tunglsins) sem snýr að sólinni er tendruð. Stig Venusar studdi kenningu Kóperníkusar um að reikistjörnurnar færu í kringum sólina. Nokkrum árum síðar, árið 1639, fylgdist enskur stjörnufræðingur að nafni Jeremiah Horrocks með þvergöngu Venusar.
mt: 3,000 years ago, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope and came to the conclusion that Venus has phases like the moon. The phases of Venus are due to the fact that only one side of Venus (or the moon) that faces the sun is illuminated. The phases of Venus supported the Copernican theory that the planets revolve around the sun. A few years later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks followed the transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Amazon-áin er næst lengsta og stærsta áin í heimi. Hún flytur áttfalt meira vatnsmagn en næststærsta áin. Amazon er einnig breiðasta á á heimi. Breiðust er hún sex mílur. Samtals 20 prósent af öllu vatni sem rennur úr ám jarðarinnar í úthöfin kemur úr Amasonánni. Amazon-áin er 6.387 km (3.980 mílur). Vatni er safnað í hana úr þúsundum minni áa.
mt: The Amazon is the second longest and largest river in the world. It carries more than half of all the water that flows out of the land into the sea. The Amazon is also the widest river in the world. It is six miles wide. Twenty percent of all the water that flows out of the land into the sea comes from the Amazon. The Amazon is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). Water is collected in it from thousands of smaller rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Átján prósent Venesúelabúa eru atvinnulausir og flestir þeirra sem eru með atvinnu starfa í svarta hagkerfinu. Tveir þriðju íbúa Venezúela sem eru með atvinnu eru í þjónustugreinum, nærri fjórðungur er í iðnaði og um fimmtungur í landbúnaði. Olíuiðnaðurinn er Venesúela afar mikilvægur, en landið er stór olíuútflytjandi þrátt fyrir að aðeins um eitt prósent landsmanna starfi í olíuiðnaðinum.
mt: 80% of Venezuelans are unemployed and most of those who are employed work in the informal sector. Two-thirds of Venezuelans who are employed work in the service sector, nearly one-fourth are in manufacturing and about one-fifth in agriculture. The oil industry is very important to Venezuela, despite the fact that only one percent of the population works in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Stjörnur gefa frá sér ljós og hita vegna orkunnar sem myndast þegar vetnisatóm eru sameinuð (eða dreifast) saman til að mynda þyngri frumefni. Vísindamenn vinna að því að smíða kjarnaofn sem getur búið til orku á sama hátt. Þetta er hins vegar mjög erfitt vandamál að leysa og það mun taka mörg ár áður en við sjáum gagnlega samrunaofna byggða.
mt: Stars emit light and heat as a result of the energy that is created (or released) when atomic nuclei are fused (or split) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a nuclear fuel that can create energy in the same way. However, this is a very difficult problem to solve and it will take many years before we see a viable nuclear fuel.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Frumefni og efnasambönd geta farið úr einu ástandi í annað án þess að breytast. Köfnunarefni sem lofttegund hefur samt sem áður sömu eiginleika og fljótandi köfnunarefni. Sameindirnar eru þær sömu þó að fljótandi ástand sé þéttara. Vatn er annað tæmi: Vatnssameindin er gerð úr tveimur vetnisatómum og einu súrefnisatómi. Það hefur ávallt sömu sameindagerðina, hvort sem það er á loftkenndu, fljótandi eða föstu formi. Þrátt fyrir að efnislegt ástand þess geti breyst helst efnafræðilegt ástand þess eins.
mt: Substances and compounds can change from one state to another without changing. Liquids that have the same properties as flowing liquids. The same compounds, although the liquid state is denser. Water is another example: The water molecule is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It always has the same molecular structure, whether it is in gaseous, liquid or solid form. Despite the fact that the physical state of the substance can change, the chemical state of the substance usually does not.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Í Frelsisstríðinu mynduðu ríkin þrettán veikburða ríkisstjórn – með Þjóðþingið sem eina þátt þess – skv. fyrstu stjórnarskránni. Þingið var ekki með nægar valdheimildir til að leggja á skatta, og vegna þess að ekki var neinn alríkisstjóri eða dómsvald til staðar, treysti það á yfirvöld í hverju ríki fyrir sig, sem voru oft og tíðum ósamvinnuþýð, til að framfylgja lögum þess. Það hafði heldur engar valdheimildir til að fella niður skattalög og tolla á milli ríkja. Greinarnar gerðu kröfu um samhljóða samþykki allra ríkjanna áður en hægt var að breyta þeim og ríkin sýndu ríkisvaldinu svo mikla lítilsvirðingu að fulltrúar þeirra voru oft fjarverandi.
mt: 12 of the 13 states in the Confederacy had legislatures that were elected by popular vote, and the Confederacy had a unicameral legislature, the Confederate Congress. The Congress had no power to levy taxes, and because there was no national executive or judiciary, the states were often at odds with each other in interpreting the laws. The states also had no power to impose tariffs or taxes between the states. Amendments required unanimous approval by all states before they could be changed, and the states showed the national government such little respect that their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: Þú gætir haldið að fjársjóðskort sé teiknað aftan á sjálfstæðisyfirlýsingu Bandaríkjanna ef þú horfðir á myndina National Treasure. Þetta er hins vegar ekki satt. Eitthvað er skrifað aftan á yfirlýsinguna, en það er ekki fjársjóðskort. Skrifað er aftan á sjálfstæðisyfirlýsinguna „Upprunalega sjálfstæðisyfirlýsingin dagsett 4. júlí 1776“. Textinn er á hvolfi neðst á skjalinu. Þó enginn viti með vissu hver skrifaði það er ljóst að snemma á ferli þess var þessu stóra pergamentskjali (75 x 62 cm) rúllað upp til að geyma það. Líklegt er að minnispunktinum hafi verið bætt við sem merkimiða.
mt: You might think that the Declaration of Independence is written on the back of the U.S. dollar bill if you look at the movie National Treasure. This is not true. Something is written on the back of the Declaration of Independence, but it is not the Declaration of Independence. The Declaration of Independence is written on the back of the original Declaration of Independence. The text is on the bottom right of the document. Although no one knows for sure who wrote it, it is clear that early in the process it was rolled up to store it. The watermark was probably added as a security measure.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Fljótlega eftir sjálfstæði þjóðarinnar hjálpaði sérfræðiþekking Singapore Botanic Gardens til við að umbreyta eyjunni í hitabeltisgarðborg. Árið 1981 varð blendingur af orkídeu með heitið Vanda Miss Joaquim fyrir valinu sem þjóðarblómið.
mt: Shortly after the country's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped transform the island into a tropical garden. In 1981, a hybrid orchid named Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Byggingu píramída úr steini var haldið áfram til loka gamla konungsríkisins, en hins vegar voru aldrei byggðir jafn stórir og tæknilega háþróaðir píramídar og píramídarnir í Gísa. Forn-Egyptar hins Nýja ríkis furðuðu sig á minnisvörðum forvera sinna sem þá voru vel yfir þúsund ára gamlir.
mt: The construction of the stone pyramid was continued until the end of the old kingdom, but no pyramids were built as large and technologically advanced as the pyramids in Giza. The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom were astonished by the monuments of their predecessors, which were then over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Í kringum október á hverju ári leggja næstum 1,5 milljón plöntuætur leið sína til sunnanverðrar sléttunnar, vaða yfir Mara-ána, frá norðanverðum hæðunum út af regntímanum. Og síðan aftur í norðvestlæga átt og aftur yfir Mara-ána eftir að regntímabilinu lýkur í apríl. Serengeti-svæðið inniheldur Serengeti-þjóðgarðinn, Ngorongoro-verndarsvæðið og friðaða Maswa-svæðið í Tansaníu og Maasai Mara-friðlandið í Kenýa.
mt: 1.5 million wildebeest migrate south from the northern hills to the Mara River after the rainy season in October. After the rainy season ends in April, they return north through the Mara River and back to the northern hills.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Í kringum október á hverju ári leggja næstum 1,5 milljón plöntuætur leið sína til sunnanverðrar sléttunnar, vaða yfir Mara-ána, frá norðanverðum hæðunum út af regntímanum. Og síðan aftur í norðvestlæga átt og aftur yfir Mara-ána eftir að regntímabilinu lýkur í apríl. Serengeti-svæðið inniheldur Serengeti-þjóðgarðinn, Ngorongoro-verndarsvæðið og friðaða Maswa-svæðið í Tansaníu og Maasai Mara-friðlandið í Kenýa.
mt: 1.5 million wildebeest migrate south from the northern hills to the Mara River after the rainy season in October. After the rainy season ends in April, they return north through the Mara River and back to the northern hills.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Þegar orustanni um Frakklandi var lokið hóf Þýskaland að undirbúa innrás Bretlands. Þýskaland gaf árásinni heitið „Aðgerðin sæljón“. Þungavopn og birgðir breska hersins höfðu tapast að mestu leyti þegar hann yfirgaf Dunkirk, þannig að herinn var frekar veikburða. En breski sjóherinn var samt mun sterkari en sá þýski („Kriegsmarine“) og hefði getað grandað hvers kyns innrásarflota sem kæmi frá Ermasundinu. Hins vegar voru ekki mörg skip breska flotans nálægt líklegum árásarleiðum, vegna þess að aðmírálarnir voru hræddir um að skipunum yrði sökkt við loftárásir þjóðverja.
mt: When the Battle of France was over, Germany began preparing for an invasion of Britain. Germany gave the operation the name "Operation Sealion". The German heavy guns and British army reserves had mostly been lost when the British army left Dunkirk, so the army was in a weakened state. However, the British navy was much stronger than the German navy ("Kriegsmarine") and could have easily repelled any invasion fleet coming from the English Channel. However, there were not many British ships near likely invasion routes, because the admirals were afraid that the ships would be sunk by German air raids.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: "Við skulum byrja á skýringum á áætlunum Ítalíu. Ítalía var að mestu „litli bróðir"" Þýskalands og Japans. Það bjó yfir vanmáttugri landher og sjóher, þrátt fyrir að hafa smíðað fjögur skip rétt áður en stríðið hófst. Helstu skotmörk Ítalíu voru Afríkulöndin. Til að taka yfir þessi lönd þyrfti Ítalía að hafa sjósetningarstað fyrir hermenn til að herliðið gæti siglt yfir Miðjarðarhafið og ráðist inn í Afríku. Þess vegna urðu þeir að losa sig við breskar herstöðvar og skip í Egyptalandi. Ítölsku orrustuskipin voru ekki ætluð í neitt að undanskildum þessum aðgerðum. Núna fyrir Japan. Japan var eyland, alveg eins og Bretland."
mt: "We will start with the Italian plans. Italy was mostly the "little brother" of Germany and Japan. It had a huge army and navy, despite having built four ships just before the war started. Italy's main targets were African countries. To take over these countries, Italy had to have naval bases for the army to sail over the Mediterranean and attack Africa. For this reason, they had to lose British naval bases and ships in Egypt. Italian warships were not intended for anything other than these operations. Now for Japan. Japan was an island, just like Britain."
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: "Landtakan á D-Day og eftirfarandi orrustur höfðu frelsað Norður-Frakkland, en Suður-Frakkland var enn ekki frjálst. Því var stjórnað af ""Vichy"" Frökkum. Þetta voru Frakkar sem höfðu friðmælst við Þjóðverja 1940 og unnið með innrásarherunum í stað þess að berjast gegn þeim. Hinn 15. ágúst 1940 gerðu bandamenn árás inn í Suður-Frakkland, innrásin var kölluð „Dragoon-aðgerðin“. Á aðeins tveimur vikum náði Bandaríkjaher og herlið Frjálsra frakka að frelsa Suður-Frakkland og héldu síðan í áttina að Þýskalandi."
mt: 15 August 1944, the D-Day landings and subsequent battles had liberated Northern France, but Southern France was still not free. It was governed by the "Vichy" French, who had surrendered to the Germans in 1940 and collaborated with the invading forces instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1944, the Allies launched an invasion into Southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon". In only two weeks, the US Army and Free French forces liberated Southern France and then moved on to Germany.
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: Kafbátar eru skip sem eru hönnuð til að sigla neðansjávar og vera þar til lengri tíma. Kafbátar voru notaðir í fyrri og síðari heimsstyrjöldinni. Á þeim tíma voru þeir mjög hægfara og skotfæri þeirra var mjög takmarkað. Í upphafi styrjaldarinnar ferðuðust þeir aðallega eftir yfirborði sjávar en eftir því sem ratsjáin þróaðist og varð nákvæmari urðu kafbátarnir að sigla neðansjávar til að koma í veg fyrir að þeir sæjust. Þýskir kafbátar voru kallaði U-bátar. Þjóðverjar voru mjög góðir í að sigla og stýra kafbátum sínum. Þjóðverjum er ekki treyst til að eiga marga kafbáta eftir stríðið sökum velgengni þeirra með þá.
mt: Submarines are ships designed to operate underwater and stay there for long periods of time. Submarines were used in both world wars. At the time they were very fast and their firepower was very limited. In the beginning of the war they mostly cruised on the surface of the water but as the technology improved and became more accurate submarines were able to operate underwater to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-boats. Germans were very good at operating and controlling their submarines. Germans are not trusted to have many submarines after the war because of their success with them during the war.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: 17. september 1939 var þegar búið að hrinda burt pólsku varnarlínunni og eina vonin fólst í að hörfa og endurskipuleggja sig við landamæri Rúmeníu. Þessar áætlanir runnu hins vegar út í sandinn um leið og yfir 800.000 hermenn úr Rauða her Sovétríkjanna réðust til atlögu og mynduðu víglínur Hvíta-Rússlands og Úkraínu eftir að herinn réðst inn í austurhéruð Póllands og braut gegn Ríga-friðarsamkomulaginu, griðarsáttmálanum á milli Sovétríkjanna og Póllands og öðrum tvíhliða og marghliða alþjóðasamningum.
mt: 17 September 1939 was when the Polish defensive line was finally broken and the only hope was to retreat and reorganize at the Romanian border. These plans however ran out in the sand as over 800,000 Red Army soldiers attacked and formed the front lines of White Russia and Ukraine after the army invaded eastern Poland and broke the Riga Peace Agreement, the peace treaty between the Soviet Union and Poland and other bilateral and multilateral international agreements.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

src: Það gekk ekki vel hjá Ítölum í Norður-Afríku nánast frá upphafi. Innan viku frá stríðsyfirlýsingu Ítalíu 10. júní 1940 höfðu meðlimir í  11. bresku Húsarahreyfingunni lagt hald á Capuzzo-virkið í Líbíu. Í launsátri austur af Bardía var Lastucci hershöfðingi og yfirverkfræðingur ítalska tíunda hersins handsamaður af Bretum. Þann 28. júní var Italo Balbo marskálkur, yfirlandstjóri yfir Líbíu og að því er virðist átt að hafa erft Mussolini, myrtur af slysaskoti við lendingu í Tobruk.
mt: It did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on Britain on June 10, 1940, members of the 11th British Hussars had taken control of the Capuzzo fort in Libya. In a desert east of Bardia, General Lastucci, commander of the Italian 10th Army Corps, was captured by the British. On June 28, Italo Balbo, governor of Libya and apparently Mussolini's heir, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: Tíbesk búddatrú byggir á kenningum Búdda, en hefur einnig orðið fyrir áhrifum frá kenningum um ást úr mahayana sem og fjölda aðferða úr inverskum jóga. Í meginatriðum er tíbeskur búddismi mjög einfaldur. Hann samanstendur af Kundalini-jóga, hugleiðslu og leið hins alltumvefjandi kærleika. Með Kundalini Jóga er Kundalini orkan (orka æðri sanninda) vakin með með jógastellingum, öndunaræfingum og sjónsköpun. Miðpunktur tíbeskrar hugleiðslu er jóga tengt goðum. Hreinsun orkubrauta fer fram með því að sjá fyrir sér ýmsa guði, orkustöðvarnar virkjast og upplýsingarvitundin er sköpuð.
mt: Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but has also been influenced by the teachings of compassion from Mahayana and a number of practices from Hatha Yoga. In its main points, Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of universal love. With Kundalini Yoga, Kundalini energy (energy of higher truth) is awakened with yoga postures, breathing exercises and visualizations. The focus of Tibetan meditation is yoga connected to gods. Purification of energy centers is done by seeing various gods, the energy centers are activated and the intuitive understanding is created.
ref: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga. In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love. With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
