src: Dóminíska lýðveldið (spænska: República Dominicana) er land í Karíbahafi sem liggur á austurhluta eyjunnar Hispaniola, sem það deilir með Haítí Fyrir utan hvítar sandstrendur og fjöllótt landslag er í landinu elsta evrópska borgin í Rómönsku Ameríku, nú hluti af Santo Domingo. Fyrst bjuggu Taínos og Caribes á eyjunni. Caribes var fólk sem talaði Arawakan sem hafði komið þanað um 10.000 f.Kr. Aðeins fáum árum eftir að evrópsku landkönnuðurnir komu hafði fjöldi Tainomanna dregist verulega saman vegna spænsku landvinningamannanna. Að sögn Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) drápu spænsku landnemarnir í kringum 100.000 Taínos (frumbyggja Karíbahafseyjanna) á árunum 1492 til 1498.
mt: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a country in the Caribbean Sea on the eastern part of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti. Besides white sand beaches and mountainous terrain, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. First inhabited by the Taínos and Caribs, the Caribs spoke Arawakan, which had come there about 10,000 BC. Only a few years after the arrival of European explorers, the number of Taínos had greatly diminished due to Spanish colonization. According to Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias), the Spanish colonizers killed about 100,000 Taínos (indigenous people of the Caribbean) between 1492 and 1498.
ref: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE. Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

src: "Snjóíþróttir niður í móti, m.a. skíða- og snjóbrettaiðkun, eru vinsælar íþróttir sem ganga út á að renna sér niður snæviþakið landslag á skíðum eða snjóbretti sem fest er við fæturna. Skíðaferðir eru mjög vinsælar hjá mörgum áhugamönnum, stundum kallaðir „skíðafríkur"", og frí eru skipulögð í kringum skíðaiþróttina á ákveðnum stöðum. Hugmyndin um það að vera á skíðum er mjög gömul. Hellamyndir sem sýna skíðamenn má finna frá því allt að 5000 f.Kr. Brun sem dægrastytting nær að minnsta kosti aftur til 17. aldar og árið 1861 var fyrsta tómstundaskíðafélagið stofnað af Norðmönnum í Ástralíu."
mt: "Downhill sports, such as skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports that involve gliding down a snow-covered slope on skis or a snowboard attached to the feet. Skiing trips are popular among many enthusiasts, sometimes called "ski vacations", and are organized around the sport at certain locations. The idea of being on skis is very old. Images of skiers can be found from as early as 5000 BC. Snowshoes date back to at least the 17th century and in 1861 the first ski club was founded by Norwegians in Australia."
ref: "Downhill snowsports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports involving sliding down snow-covered terrain with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet. Skiing is a major travelling activity with many enthusiasts, occasionally known as ""ski bums,"" planning entire vacations around skiing at a particular location. The idea of skiing is very old — cave paintings depicting skiers date back as far as 5000 BC! Downhill skiing as a sport goes back to at least the 17th century, and in 1861 the first recreational ski club was opened by Norwegians in Australia."

src: Austur-Afríkueyjar eru í Indlandshafi undan austurströnd Afríku. Madagaskar er langstærst og heimsálfa ein og sér hvað dýralíf varðar. Flestar smærri eyjarnar eru sjálfstæð ríki, eða tengd Frakklandi, og þekktar sem lúxus stranddvalarstaðir. Arabar komu fluttu einnig múhameðstrú til landanna og hún varð virkilega vinsæl á Kómorum og Mayotte. Á 15. öld fór að gæta evrópskra áhrifa og nýlendustefnan hófst, þar sem portúgalski landkönnuðurinn Vasco da Gama uppgötvaði leiðina frá Evrópu til Indlands um Góðravonarhöfða.
mt: The East African islands are in the Indian Ocean off the east coast of Africa. Madagascar is the largest and only island country in the world. Most of the smaller islands are independent countries, or tied to France, and known as luxury beach resorts. Arabs also brought Islam to the islands and it became very popular on Comoros and Mayotte. In the 15th century, European influence began and the colonial era started, where Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama discovered the route from Europe to India around the Cape of Good Hope.
ref: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife. Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts. The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.

src: Hefð er fyrir því að vaka páskanóttina á einhverjum stað utandyra til að sjá sólarupprásina. Finna má að sjálfsögðu guðfræðilegar skýringar á þessum venjum, en þetta gæti vel verið helgisiður fyrir vor og frjósemi í kristni. Hefðbundnari kirkjur eru oft með páskavöku á laugardagskvöldinu um páskahelgina. Söfnuðir hefja oft hátíðarhöld á miðnætti til að fagna upprisu Krists.
mt: It is customary to watch Easter sunrise on some outdoor location to see the sun rise. There are of course religious explanations for this, but this could be a holy ritual for spring and fertility in Christianity. More traditional churches often have Easter vigils on Good Friday evening. Sects often have celebrations at midnight to celebrate the resurrection of Christ.
ref: There's a tradition to pass the Easter night awake at some exposed point to see the sunrise. There are of course Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it may well be a pre-Christian Spring and Fertility ritual. More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.

src: Ekvador krefst þess að kúbanskir ríkisborgarar fái boðsbréf áður en þeir koma til Ekvador í gegnum alþjóðlega flugvelli eða landamærastöðvar. Bréfið verður að vera lögfest af utanríkisráðuneyti Ekvador og það skal uppfylla ákveðnar kröfur. Þessar kröfur eru hannaðar til að veita skipulagt farandflæði milli beggja landa. Kúbanskir ríkisborgarar, sem eru handhafar bandaríska græna kortsins, ættu að fara á ræðisskrifstofu Ekvador til að öðlast undanþágu frá þessari kröfu. Vegabréf verður að gilda a.m.k. 6 mánuði fram yfir ferðadagana. Sýna þarf farseðil fram og tilbaka til að sanna hve löng dvölin verður.
mt: Ecuador requires Cuban citizens to obtain a visa before they arrive in Ecuador through an international airport or land border crossing. The visa must be certified by Ecuador's Ministry of Foreign Affairs and it must meet certain requirements. These requirements are designed to provide orderly travel between the two countries. Cuban citizens, who are holders of the American Green Card, must go to the Ecuadorian embassy to obtain an exemption from this requirement. A visa must be valid for at least 6 months before the travel dates. Proof of round-trip travel must be shown to prove how long the stay will be.
ref: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points. This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements. These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries. Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.

src: Gleraugu kunna að vera ódýrari í útlöndum, einkum í lágtekjulöndum þar sem launakostnaður er lægri. Íhugaðu að láta gera augnrannsókn heima hjá þér, sérstaklega ef tryggingin nær yfir það, og fá lyfseðilinn með þar sem pappírsvinnan verður gerð annars staðar. Umgjörðum frá vinsælum vörumerkjum sem fást á slíkum stöðum kunna að fylgja tvennskonar vandamál; sumar kunna að vera eftirlíkingar og innfluttar ósviknar umgjarðir kunna að vera dýrari en í heimalandinu.
mt: Glasses can be cheaper in developing countries, especially in low-income countries where labor costs are lower. Consider having an eye exam done at home, especially if the coverage extends to it, and get the prescription filled elsewhere. Counterfeits of popular brands available at such places can have two-fold problems; some can be fakes and imported counterfeit packaging can be more expensive than at home.
ref: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower. Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere. High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.

src: Opinber gjaldmiðill Falklandseyja er falklenskt pund (FKP) en gildi þess er jafngilt einu bresku pundi (GBP). Peningum er hægt að skipta í eina bankanum á eyjunum sem er staðsettur í Stanley á móti FIC West-versluninni. Tekið er við breskum pundum á flestum stöðum á eyjunni og í Stanley er einnig oft tekið við kreditkortum og bandaríkjadölum. Á úteyjunum verður líklega ekki tekið við kreditkortum þó að verið gæti að tekið sé við breskum og bandarískum gjaldmiðli. Athugaðu hjá eigendunum með fyrirvara hvaða greiðslumáta er tekið við. Það er nánast ómögulegt að skipta gjaldmiðli Falklandseyja utan eyjanna og því er ráðlegt að skipta gjaldmiðlinum áður en farið er af eyjunum.
mt: The official currency of the Falkland Islands is the Falkland pound (FKP), which is pegged to the British pound (GBP). There is only one bank on the islands, which is located in Stanley, and it is affiliated with FIC West. British pounds are accepted at most places on the islands, and in Stanley, credit cards and US dollars are also often accepted. Credit cards are unlikely to be accepted on the outlying islands, although British and US dollars may be accepted. Check with the owners beforehand what payment methods are accepted. It is almost impossible to exchange Falkland pounds outside the islands, so it is advisable to exchange them before leaving the islands.
ref: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP). Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store. British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted. On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method. It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.

src: Flest musterin eru með árlega hátíð frá nóvember fram í miðjan maí, sem er mismunandi eftir árlegu dagatali hvers musteris. Flestar musterishátíðirnar eru haldnar hátíðlegar sem hluti af afmæli musterisins eða á afmælisdegi guðsins eða öðrum stórviðburðum sem tengjast musterinu. Musterishátíðir í Kerala eru mjög áhugaverðar. Þar má sjá fjölmargar skrúðgöngur með skreyttum fílum, musterishljómsveitir og önnur hátíðarhöld.
mt: Most festivals are held annually from November to mid-May, which varies by the calendar of the festival. Most festivals are celebrated as part of the anniversary of the festival or on the anniversary day of the god or other major events related to the festival. Festivals in Kerala are very popular. There you can see many processions with decorated elephants, festival bands and other festive events.
ref: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar. Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple. Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.

src: Augljósasta leiðin til að fljúga á fyrsta farrými eða á viðskiptafarrými er með því að leggja fram þykkt peningabúnt fyrir forréttindin (enn betra, fá fyrirtækið þitt til að gera það fyrir þig). Ekki er hægt að segja að þetta sé ódýrt: Yfirleitt má búast við að greiða allt að fjórum sinnum hærra verð en fyrir venjulegt viðskiptafarrými og ellefu sinnum hærra verð en fyrir fyrsta farrými! Almennt séð er ekkert vit í að leita að afsláttum af sætum í vildarfarrými eða fyrsta farrými í beinu flugi frá A til B. Flugfélög gera sér grein fyrir að tiltekinn samfélagshópur er reiðubúinn að greiða hátt gjald fyrir forréttindin að ferðast hratt og í miklum þægindum.
mt: The most obvious way to fly in the first or business class is to submit a thick check for the privilege (better yet, get your company to do it for you). It is not cheap: typically you can expect to pay four times the price of a regular business class and eleven times the price of a regular economy class! In general, there is no point in looking for discounts on seats in the first or business class in a direct flight from A to B. Airlines are aware that a certain social group is willing to pay a high fee for the privilege of traveling fast and in great comfort.
ref: The obvious way of flying in first or business class is to fork out a thick wad of money for the privilege (or, better yet, get your company to do it for you). However, this does not come cheap: as rough rules of thumb, you can expect to pay up to four times the normal economy fare for business, and eleven times for first class! Generally speaking, there is no point in even looking for discounts for business or first-class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know well that there is a certain core group of flyers who are willing to pay top dollar for the privilege of getting somewhere fast and in comfort, and charge accordingly.

src: Flugfélög eins og Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways og Turkish Airlines hafa bætt þjónustu sína í Afríku til muna og bjóða tengiflug til stærstu borga Afríku á lægra verði en flugfélög í Evrópu. Frá og með 2014 fljúga tyrknesk flugfélög til 39 áfangastaða í 30 afrískum löndum. Ef þú hefur ferðatíma aflögu skaltu athuga hver heildarkostnaður við fargjaldið til Afríku er samanborið við flug í kringum heiminn. Ekki gleyma að bæta við aukakostnaði sem fylgir fleiri vegabréfsáritunum, flugvallarsköttum, samgöngum á landi o.s.frv. fyrir alla staði utan Afríku.
mt: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways and Turkish Airlines have increased their service to Africa and offer connections to major African cities at lower prices than European airlines. From 2014, Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries. If you have a layover time, check the total cost of the fare to Africa compared to flights around the world. Do not forget to add additional costs such as additional passport stamps, airport taxes, land transportation, etc. for all stops outside Africa.
ref: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways & Turkish Airlines have greatly expanded their services to Africa, and offer connections to many major African cities at competitive rates than other European airlines. Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries as of 2014. If you have additional travel time, check to see how your total fare quote to Africa compares with a round-the-world fare. Don't forget to add in the extra costs of additional visas, departure taxes, ground transportation, etc. for all those places outside of Africa.

src: Að versla í stórmarkaði er yfirleitt ódýrasta leiðin til að borða. Án eldunaraðstöðu einskorðast möguleikarnir hins vegar við tilbúinn mat. Í æ ríkara mæli bjóða stórverslanir upp á fjölbreyttan skyndimat. Slíkar verslanir bjóða jafnvel upp á örbylgjuofna eða annan búnað til að hita upp matinn. Í sumum löndum eða tegundum verslana er a.m.k. einn veitingastaður á staðnum, oft frekar óformlegur staður þar sem maturinn er á viðráðanlegu verði.
mt: In general, the cheapest way to eat is to buy in bulk. Without a microwave, however, the possibilities are limited. In wealthier countries, supermarkets offer a wide variety of ready-made meals. Some supermarkets even offer a microwave or other heating device to heat up the food. In some countries or types of supermarkets, there is at least one restaurant on the premises, often a rather informal place where the food is at a reasonable price.
ref: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food. Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food. In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.

src: Franska mállýskan sem töluð er í Belgíu og Sviss er aðeins frábrugðin þeirri frönsku sem töluð eru í Frakklandi. Málin eru þó líka að þau eru skiljanleg. Númerakerfið í frönskumælandi hlutum Belgíu og Sviss hefur nokkur sérkenni sem eru ólík frönskunni sem töluð er í Frakklandi, einnig er framburður tiltekinna orða nokkuð frábrugðinn. Allir frönskumælandi Belgar og Svisslendingar hefðu engu að síður lært hefðbundna frönsku í skóla. Þeir myndu því skilja þig jafnvel þótt þú notir ekki hið hefðbundna franska númerakerfið.
mt: The French dialect spoken in Belgium and Switzerland is only distinguished from the French spoken in France. However, the languages are still mutually intelligible. The number system in French-speaking parts of Belgium and Switzerland has some peculiarities that are different from the French spoken in France, as well as the pronunciation of certain words. All French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school. They would thus understand you even though you do not use the standard French number system.
ref: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. In particular, the numbering system in French-speaking Belgium and Switzerland has some slight peculiarities that are different from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of some words is slightly different. Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

src: Aðeins fá flugfélög bjóða enn gjöld vegna ástvinamissis sem lækka lítillega kostnað vegna ferðalaga á síðustu stundu sökum útfarar. Flugfélög sem bjóða upp á slíkt eru m.a. Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa fyrir flug frá Bandaríkjunum eða Kanada og WestJet. Þú verður alltaf að bóka beint hjá flugfélaginu í gegnum síma.
mt: Only a few airlines are offering refunds for missed connections that are causing little inconvenience to passengers. Airlines offering such refunds are Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights from the United States or Canada and WestJet. You must always book directly with the airline via phone.
ref: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which slightly discount the cost of last-minute funeral travel. Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

src: Það kann að vera auðveldast og þægilegast að rata í útlöndum með GPS leiðsöguappi í snjallsímanum. Þetta er ódýrara en að kaupa ný kort fyrir GPS-kerfi, stakt GPS-tæki eða leigja tæki af bílaleigufyrirtæki. Ef engin gagnatenging er fyrir hendi í símanum þínum eða þegar hann er utan þjónustusvæðis kann að draga úr afköstunum.
mt: It is easiest and most convenient to navigate in foreign countries with a GPS navigation app on your smartphone. This is cheaper than buying new maps for a GPS device, a separate GPS device, or renting a device from a car rental company. If no internet connection is available on your phone or when it is out of service area, it can reduce the results.
ref: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate when out of your home country. It can save money over buying new maps for a GPS, or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or when it is out of range, their performance can be limited or unavailable.

src: Best er að skoða staði og dýralíf Galapagos bátleiðis líkt og Charles Darwin gerði árið 1835. Fleiri en 60 skemmtiferðaskip sigla um vatnasvæði Galapagos með 8-100 farþega um borð. Flestir bóka með góðum fyrirvara (þar sem bátarnir eru yfirleitt fullir yfir háannatímann). Gakktu úr skugga um að umboðsaðilinn sem þú bókar í gegnum sé vel kunnugur Galapagoseyjum og hafi góða kunnáttu á mismunandi skipum. Þannig er séð til þess að sérstakt áhugasvið þitt og/eða skorður fari saman við skipið sem hentar þeim best.
mt: It is best to see the Galapagos Islands as Charles Darwin did in 1835. More than 60 cruise ships sail the Galapagos waters with 8-100 passengers on board. Most are booked well in advance (as the boats are usually full for the high season). Be sure to book through a reputable agent who is well acquainted with the Galapagos and has good knowledge of different ships. This way your specific interests and/or dietary needs can be matched to the best ship for you.
ref: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835. Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season). Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships. This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.

src: Spilavíti leggja yfirleitt mikið upp úr því að fá gesti til að eyða sem mestum tíma og peningum. Oftast nær eru gluggar og klukkur hvergi að finna og það getur verið erfitt að finna útgang. Það eru venjulega sérstakt tilboð á mat, drykk og skemmtun, til að halda gestum í góðu skapi og halda þeim á staðnum. Sumir staðir bjóða upp á gjaldfrjálsa áfenga drykki. Ölvun skerðir dómgreind og allir góðir fjárhættuspilarar þekkja mikilvægi þess að vera allsgáður.
mt: Most people are willing to spend a lot of time and money to get away from it all. Usually there are no clocks or windows to be found and it can be difficult to find the exit. There are usually special offers on food, drink and entertainment, to keep guests in good spirits and keep them on site. Some places offer free alcoholic drinks. Drunkenness impairs judgment and all good risk managers know the importance of being well-lit.
ref: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find. They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise. Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.

src: Öll nafnorð byrja á stórum staf auk orðsins Sie sem þýðir þú, jafnvel í miðjum setningum. Þetta er gagnleg aðgerð til að greina á milli sagna og andlags. Þetta auðveldar lestur en flækir skrift því finna verður hvort sagnorð eða atviksorð er notað sem nafnorð.
mt: All nouns begin with a capital letter, including the word Sie which means you, even in the middle of a sentence. This is a helpful practice to distinguish between nouns and pronouns. It simplifies reading but complicates writing because you have to determine whether a noun or pronoun is being used as a noun.
ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

src: "Víðsvegar í veröldinni er vinarkveðja að veifa og slík bending þýðir ""halló."" Slík bending þýðir ""komdu hingað"" í Malasíu, eða að minnsta kosti á meðal malasíubúa í dreifbýli. Þetta er svipuð bending og að beygja vísifingur í áttina að líkamanum, en sú bending er notuð sumstaðar á Vesturlöndum, og skal einungis nota í þeim tilgangi. Á sama hátt getur breskur ferðamaður á Spáni misskilið þegar veifað er bless og lófin snýr að þeim sem veifar (í stað þeim sem veifað er að) sem merki um að koma aftur."
mt: "In most of the world, waving and such bending means "hello." Such bending means "come here" in Malaysia, or at least among Malaysians in rural areas. This is similar to bending the index finger towards the person, but that bending is used in some parts of the Western world, and should only be used for that purpose. A British tourist in Spain may be confused when waving is done with the palm facing the person being waved at (instead of the person waving) as a sign of returning.
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: Jöklarnir eru ekki stöðugir. Þeir færast til niður fjallið. Slíkt skapar sprungur, jökulsprungur sem geta verið huldar af snjóbrúm. Veggir og þök íshella geta fallið saman og sprungur geta einnig gert hið sama. Gríðarstórir ísklumpar brotna af jökulbrúnum, falla niður og veltast jafnvel enn lengra frá brúninni.
mt: Glaciers are not static. They move down the mountain. Such creates crevasses, icefalls that can be hidden by snow bridges. Walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and crevasses can do the same. Gigantic icebergs break off from the glacier, fall down and even roll further away from the glacier.
ref: The glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This will cause cracks, crevasses, which may be obscured by snow bridges. The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and cracks can get closed. At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge.

src: Goma er ferðamannaborg í Lýðveldinu Kongó lengst í austri nálægt Rúanda. Árið 2002 eyðilagðist Goma í eldgosi Nyiragongo-eldfjallsins sem gróf flestar götur bæjarins í hraunrennslinu, þó sér í lagi miðhlutann. Þó Goma sé nokkuð örugg, skal huga vel að öllum ferðum út fyrir Goma, til að átta sig á hver staða átakanna er sem geysa enn í héraðinu North Kivu. Borgin er einnig bækistöð fyrir uppgöngu á Nyiragongo-eldfjallið ásamt einni af ódýrustu göngunum til að skoða fjallagórillur í Afríku. Notast má við boda-boda (vélhjólataxa) til að ferðast um Goma. Venjulegt verð (innan svæðis) er ~500 kongólskir frankar fyrir stutta ferð.
mt: Goma is a city in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, located in the east of the country, near Rwanda. In 2002, Goma was devastated by the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano, which buried much of the city in lava, especially the center. Although Goma is relatively safe, one should be careful of all trips outside of Goma, to know the current state of the conflict in the region North Kivu. The city is also a base for the exploration of the Nyiragongo volcano, as well as one of the cheapest ways to see gorillas in Africa. Boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) can be used to travel around Goma. The usual price (within the area) is ~500 Congolese francs for a short trip.
ref: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda. In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre. While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province. The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa. You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.

src: Sækja verður um öræfaleyfi til að slá upp tjaldbúðum í Grand Canyon. Leyfi eru takmörkuð til að vernda gljúfrið og verða fáanleg 1. dag mánaðarins, fjórum mánuðum fyrir upphafsmánuðinn. Því verða í boði óbyggðaleyfi þann 1. janúar fyrir ferðir í maí. Pláss á vinsælustu svæðunum, svo sem Bright Angel-tjaldsvæðið við hliðina á Phantom Ranch, eru yfirleitt pöntuð fljótt þegar beiðnir sem berast fyrsta daginn eru opnaðar. Takmarkaður fjöldi leyfa er í boði fyrir staðarbeiðnir og þar gildir reglan, fyrstur kemur, fyrstur fær.
mt: 1. January is the first day of the month, four months before the start of the month. So, permits are available for trips in May. The most popular sites, such as the Bright Angel campground near the Phantom Ranch, are usually booked quickly when applications are opened on the first day. A limited number of permits are available for local applications and the rule applies, first come, first served.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month. Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

src: Sum hótel búa yfir arfleifð frá gullöld gufulesta og millilandaskipa, fyrir síðari heimsstyrjöldina, frá 19. öld eða snemma á 20. öld. Þetta eru hótel þar sem þeir ríku og frægu þess tíma gistu og oft var boðið upp á fágaðan mat og næturlíf. Gamaldags innréttingar, skortur á nýjustu þægindum og ákveðin aldurseinkenni eru hluti af karakter þeirra. Þó það sé yfirleitt í einkaeigu er stundum tekið á móti þjóðhöfðingjum og öðrum háttsettum aðilum. Ferðalangur með nóg á milli handanna gæti viljað skoða flug umhverfis jörðina, með viðkomu á mörgum þessara hótela.
mt: Some hotels have a legacy from the gold rush and transcontinental railroad, from the late 19th century or early 20th century. These are hotels where the rich and famous of that time stayed and were often offered fine dining and nightlife. Old-fashioned decor, lack of modern amenities and certain age restrictions are part of their character. Although it is usually privately owned, it is sometimes taken by heads of state and other high-ranking individuals. A tourist with enough money between their hands may want to see a flight around the world, with stops at many of these hotels.
ref: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries. These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife. The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character. While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.

src: "Grænland er með góða tengingu og 93% íbúanna eru með netaðgang þökk sé ljósleiðaratengingu í hafi til Evrópu og um breiðbandsgervihnetti. Á hótelinu eða hjá gestgjöfunum (ef gist er á gistiheimili eða inni á heimili) er líklega þráðlaust neða eða tölva tengd interneti og allar byggðir eru með internet kaffihús eða slíkt með almennu neti. Eins og minnst er á hér að ofan, þótt orðið ""eskimói"" sé almennt talið viðeigandi í Bandaríkjunum, finnst mörgum íbúum norðurskautsins það vera niðrandi, sérstaklega í Kanada. Þó Grænlendingar heyrist nota orðið ættu útlendingar að forðast að nota það. Innfæddir íbúar Grænlands kalla sig inúíta í Kanada og Kalaalleq (fleirtala Kalaallit), Grænlending, á Grænlandi. Glæpir og almenn óvild í garð útlendinga er nánast óþekkt á Grænlandi. Í bæjunum eru meira að segja engin ""slæm hverfi."" Kalt veðurfar er sennilega eina raunverulega hættan sem steðjar að þeim sem eru vanbúnir. Ef þú heimsækir Grænland að vetri til (með það í huga að kaldara verður eftir því sem norðar dregur) verður þú að taka með nægilega hlýjan fatnað. Mjög langir sumardagar geta skapað vandamál hvað nægjan svefn varðar og tengd heilsufarsvandamál. Að sumarlagi ætti líka að varast norrænu moskítófluguna. Þótt hún beri enga sjúkdóma á milli manna, getur hún verið þreytandi."
mt: "Greenland has good connectivity and 93% of the population have internet access, thanks to the undersea cable to Europe and broadband internet. At the hotel or with the host (if you are at a guesthouse or inside a home) there is likely a wireless or computer connected internet and all settlements have internet at coffee shops or similar with general internet. As mentioned above, although the word "eskimo" is generally considered acceptable in the United States, many people in the northern hemisphere find it offensive, especially in Canada. However, Greenlanders are used to foreigners using the word and foreigners should avoid using it. Inuit in Canada and Kalaallit (plural Kalaallit), Greenlanders, in Greenland call themselves. Gaffes and general rudeness towards foreigners is almost unknown in Greenland. In the settlements there are no "bad neighborhoods." Cold weather is probably the only real danger that unprepared people face. If you visit Greenland in the winter (with the idea that it will get colder the further north you go) you will need to bring adequate warm clothing. Very long summer days can create problems regarding adequate sleep and related health issues. Also, at the height of summer, beware of the northern mosquito. Although it does not carry any diseases between people, it can be annoying."
ref: "Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access. Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi. As mentioned above, though the word ""Eskimo"" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada. While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners. The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland. Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no ""rough areas."" Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face. If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing. The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues. During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating."

src: "Grænland er með góða tengingu og 93% íbúanna eru með netaðgang þökk sé ljósleiðaratengingu í hafi til Evrópu og um breiðbandsgervihnetti. Á hótelinu eða hjá gestgjöfunum (ef gist er á gistiheimili eða inni á heimili) er líklega þráðlaust neða eða tölva tengd interneti og allar byggðir eru með internet kaffihús eða slíkt með almennu neti. Eins og minnst er á hér að ofan, þótt orðið ""eskimói"" sé almennt talið viðeigandi í Bandaríkjunum, finnst mörgum íbúum norðurskautsins það vera niðrandi, sérstaklega í Kanada. Þó Grænlendingar heyrist nota orðið ættu útlendingar að forðast að nota það. Innfæddir íbúar Grænlands kalla sig inúíta í Kanada og Kalaalleq (fleirtala Kalaallit), Grænlending, á Grænlandi. Glæpir og almenn óvild í garð útlendinga er nánast óþekkt á Grænlandi. Í bæjunum eru meira að segja engin ""slæm hverfi."" Kalt veðurfar er sennilega eina raunverulega hættan sem steðjar að þeim sem eru vanbúnir. Ef þú heimsækir Grænland að vetri til (með það í huga að kaldara verður eftir því sem norðar dregur) verður þú að taka með nægilega hlýjan fatnað. src: Jardín de la Unión. Þetta rými var byggt sem aðalsalur fyrir 17. aldar klaustur, en Templo de San Diego er eina eftirstandandi byggingin. Núna er það aðaltorgið og er iðandi af lífi, að nóttu sem degi. Fjöldi veitingastaða er í kringum garðinn og síðdegis og á kvöldin eru oft haldnir ókeypis tónleikar í garðskálanum í miðjunni. Callejon del Beso (Kossadalurinn). Tvennar svalir með aðeins 69 sentímetrum á milli eru heimkynni gamallar ástarsögu. Fyrir nokkra aura munu sumir krakkar segja þér söguna.
mt: 17th century convent cloister. The Temple of San Diego is the only remaining building. Now it is the main square and is lively day and night. Many restaurants are around the garden and in the evenings and at night free concerts are held in the garden in the middle. Callejon del Beso (Kiss Alley). Two narrow alleys with only 69 centimeters between them are the home of an old love story. For a few pesos some men will tell you the story.
ref: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo. Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend. For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: Gönguferðir eru hreyfing utandyra sem felur í sér að ganga í náttúrunni, iðulega á göngustígum. Dagslöng fjallganga felur í sér vegalengd frá undir einni mílu til lengri vegalengda sem hægt er að komast yfir á einum degi. Fyrir heilsdags göngur á auðveldum slóða þarf ekki mikinn undirbúning og allir sem eru í miðlungsgóðu formi geta notið þeirra. Fjölskyldur með lítil börn þurfa ef til vill meiri undirbúning, en það er vel hægt að eyða degi úti við þrátt fyrir ungbörn og börn á leikskólaaldri.
mt: Hiking is a form of walking, usually done with the specific purpose of exploring the outdoors. Day hikes are walks of one day or less in length. For healthy people, no special preparation is needed for day hikes on easy trails. Families with young children may need more preparation, but it is possible to spend a day outdoors with young children and infants.
ref: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails. Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day. For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them. Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.

src: "Landslag í Noregi einkennist af djúpum fjörðum og dölum sem svo víkja fyrir hásléttu. Háslétturnar ganga oft undir nafninu „vidde“ sem þýðir breitt, opið trjálaust rými, víðátta án takmörkunar. Í Rogalandi og Agder kallast þær yfirleitt ""hei"" eða skóglaust mýrlendi sem er oft þakið beitilyngi."
mt: "The landscape of Norway is characterized by deep fjords and valleys that are then interrupted by high plateaus. The high plateaus are often referred to as "vidde" which means broad, open, treeless space, wide open spaces without limits. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called "hei" or treeless peatland that is often covered by grazing."
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

src: Á indverska sumrinu nær ferðamannatími hæðarstöðva yfirleitt hámarki. Slík fjallþorp búa hins vegar yfir annarri fegurð og töfrum yfir vetrartímann. Oft snjóar mikið í fjallaþorpunum og þar er hægt að leggja stund á vetraríþróttir eins og að fara á skíði eða snjóbretti.
mt: During the Indian summer, tourist season usually peaks. Such hill stations, however, have another charm and wonders over the winter season. Often, it snows heavily in hill stations and there is a chance to indulge in winter sports like skiing or snowboarding.
ref: The tourist season for the hill stations generally peaks during the Indian summer. However, they have a different kind of beauty and charm during winter, with many hill stations receiving healthy amounts of snow and offering activities such as skiing and snowboarding.

src: Á indverska sumrinu nær ferðamannatími hæðarstöðva yfirleitt hámarki. Slík fjallþorp búa hins vegar yfir annarri fegurð og töfrum yfir vetrartímann. Oft snjóar mikið í fjallaþorpunum og þar er hægt að leggja stund á vetraríþróttir eins og að fara á skíði eða snjóbretti.

src: Þegar þú kemur á smábátahöfnina geturðu verið viss um að allt sé nokkuð augljóst. Þú munt hitta aðra puttaferðalanga í leit að fari með báti og þeir munu deila reynslu sinni með þér. Þú munt setja upp auglýsingar þar sem þú býður fram þjónustu þína, gengur um höfnina, talar við fólkið sem er að þrífa snekkjurnar sínar, reynir að hitta hásetana á barnum o.s.frv. Reyndu að tala við sem flesta. Ekki líður á löngu áður en allir kannast við þig og gefa þér vísbendingu um hvaða bátur er að leita að einhverjum.
mt: When you arrive at a small boat harbor, you may be sure that everything is quite obvious. You will find other boat owners looking for a ride and they will share their experience with you. You will put up signs offering your service, walk around the harbor, talk to people who are mooring their boats, look for the kids on board, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. It doesn't take long before everyone knows you and gives you a sign of what boat they are looking for.
ref: Be assured that once you hit the marinas everything will be pretty obvious. You will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you. Basically you'll be putting up notices offering your help, pacing the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while everyone will know you and will give you hints as to which boat is looking for someone.

src: Landssvæðið Hong Kong er nefnt eftir Hong Kong-eyjunni og þar koma flestir ferðamenn í heimsókn. Röð bygginga sem sem skapa sjóndeildarhring Hong Kong hefur stundum verið líkt við glitrandi súlurit. Það kemur fram með sjónum í Victoria-höfninni. Besta útsýnið yfir Hong Kong fæst af Kowloon sjávarbakkanum andspænis. Mikill meirihluti þéttbýlisskipulags Hong Kong-eyju er þéttskipað á endurheimtu landsvæði meðfram norðurströndinni. Þetta er staðurinn sem breskir landnemarnir tóku sem sinn eigin og ef þú ert að leita að sönnunargögnum um nýlendutíma fortíðarinnar er þetta góður staður til að byrja.
mt: Hong Kong is named after Hong Kong Island and is where most visitors come to visit. The row of buildings that create the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering necklace. It is visible from Victoria Harbour. The best view of Hong Kong is from Kowloon Waterfront. Most of the densely populated Hong Kong Island is built on reclaimed land along the northern shore. This is the place where the British settlers took as their own and if you are looking for evidence of colonial times past this is a good place to start.
ref: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus. The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour. To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite. The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore. This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.

src: Ístöð eru styðja við knapafætur sem hanga hvorum megin við hnakkinn. Þeir veita meiri stöðugleika fyrir knapann en geta verið öryggisatriði vegna möguleika á að fætur knapans festist í þeim. Ef knapi fellur af baki en einn fótur hans er fastur í ístaðinu getur hesturinn dregið hann á eftir sér ef hann hleypur í burtu. Hægt er að gera nokkrar öryggisráðstafanir til að draga úr hættunni á slíku. Fyrir það fyrsta klæðast flestir reiðmenn reiðstígvélum með hæl og sléttum, frekar mjóum, sóla. Næst, sumir hnakkar, einkum enskir ​​hnakkar, eru með með öryggisstengur sem hafa í för með sér að ístaðsleður dettur af hnakkinum ef togað er afturábak í það því reiðmaðurinn dettur.
mt: The stirrup is attached to the saddle by two leather straps, one on each side of the horse's girth. The stirrup provides greater stability for the rider's foot than the simple leather loop, and can be a safety feature because if the stirrup comes off the saddle, the rider will be dragged along behind the horse if it bolts. Several safety measures can be taken to reduce the risk of this. Most riders wear riding boots with a heel and toe, rather than a flat sole. Next, some saddles, especially English saddles, have safety stirrups that have a feature that if the stirrup comes off the saddle, the stirrup detaches from the saddle, so the rider will not be dragged.
ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

src: Fyrirtæki sem nota skiptikerfi á gistirými tengja ferðamenn við íbúa borganna sem þeir heimsækja. Yfirleitt er nóg að fylla út eyðublað á netinu til að gerast meðlimur í svona samtökum þó sum samtök bjóði upp á eða geri kröfu um viðbótarsannvottun. Þar á eftir er afhent prentað eintak af gestgjafalistanum eða listinn er birtur á netinu, stundum með meðmælum og umsögnum frá öðrum ferðalöngum. Couchsurfing var stofnað í janúar 2004 þegar forritarinn Casey Fenton fann ódýrt flug til Íslands en var með engan stað til að gista á. Hann sendi nemendum í nærliggjandi háskóla tölvupóst og fékk fjöldann allan af tilboðum um fría gistingu.
mt: Companies that use peer-to-peer lodging networks connect travelers with residents of the cities they visit. Usually, it is enough to fill out a form on the Internet to become a member of such networks, though some networks offer or require additional verification. After that, a printed copy of the guest list or the list is published on the Internet, sometimes with comments and recommendations from other travelers. CouchSurfing was founded in January 2004 when programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but had no place to stay. He sent an email to students at nearby universities and received a flood of offers of free lodging.
ref: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit. Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification. A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers. Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay. He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.

src: Farfuglaheimili eru fyrst og fremst ætluð yngra fólki – yfirleitt eru gestirnir á þrítugsaldri – en oft gista eldri ferðalangar þar líka. Ekki er mikið um fjölskyldur með börn, en slíkar fjölskyldur mega gista á einkaherbergjum á sumum farfuglaheimilum.
mt: Bird sanctuaries are primarily intended for younger people – usually guests are in their twenties – but older tourists also stay there. There are not many families with children, but such families can stay in private rooms at some bird sanctuaries.
ref: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too. Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.

src: Bjúgverpilskast er vinsæl iðja sem margir ferðamenn vilja ná valdi á. Ef þú vilt læra að kasta bjúgverpli og fá hann til að koma til baka í hönd þína verður þú að nota bjúgverpil af réttri gerð. Flest búmeröng sem tiltæk eru í Ástralíu koma í raun ekki til baka. Best er að byrjendur hendi ekki í vindi
mt: The boomerang is a popular toy that many tourists want to master. If you want to learn to throw a boomerang and get it to come back into your hand, you will need to use a boomerang of the right type. Most boomerangs that are available in Australia do not come back. Beginners should not start in the wind.
ref: Boomerang throwing is a popular skill that many tourists want to acquire. If you want to learn throwing a boomerang that comes back to your hand, make sure you have a suitable boomerang for returning. Most boomerangs available in Australia are in fact non-returning. It is best for beginners to not try throwing in windy

src: Í Indónesíu eru 17.000 eyjar og því er nær hugtakið indónesískur matur yfir gríðarlegt úrval svæðisbundinna rétta um ríkið allt. En ef notað án frekari einkennandi þátta á hugtakið við um mat sem má rekja til mið- og austurhluta Jövu. Javanskir réttur eru núna framreiddir víða um eyjaklasann. Boðið er upp á fjölbreytt úrval af einföldum og bragðmiklum  réttum, þar sem javanskt ​​bragð ræður ríkjum, það er jarðhnetur, eldpipar, sykur (einkum javanskur kókossykur) og ýmis ilmandi krydd.
mt: 17,000 islands make up Indonesia, and the term Indonesian cuisine refers to a vast array of regional dishes from across the archipelago. But if used without further qualification, it usually refers to food from the central and eastern parts of Java. Javanese dishes are now served throughout the islands. A varied selection of simple and flavorful dishes are offered, where Javanese flavor reigns supreme, that is, earthy, spicy, and sweet, with a hint of coconut, and a variety of pungent spices.
ref: With 17,000 islands to choose from, Indonesian food is an umbrella term covering a vast variety of regional cuisines found across the nation. But, if used without further qualifiers, the term tends to mean the food originally from the central and eastern parts of the main island Java. Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.

src: Fyrir þá sem skilja ekki læknamál hafa orðin „infectious“ og „contagious“ ólíka merkingu. Sýklar eins og veirur, bakteríur, sveppir eða önnur sníkjudýr valda smitsjúkdómum. Smitsjúkdómur er sjúkdómur sem smitast auðveldlega á milli fólks sem er nálægt sýktri manneskju. Margar ríkisstjórnir krefjast þess að gestir sem koma inn í landið, eða íbúar sem yfirgefa það, séu bólusettir gegn ýmsum sjúkdómum. Þessar kröfur geta oft verið háðar hvaða lönd ferðamaður hefur heimsótt eða hyggst heimsækja.
mt: For those who don't know medical terminology, "infectious" and "contagious" have different meanings. Viruses, bacteria, fungi, or other parasites cause infectious diseases. An infectious disease is a disease that spreads easily between people who are near an infected person. Many governments require visitors to a country, or residents leaving it, to be vaccinated against certain diseases. These requirements may be imposed on countries a traveler has visited or plans to visit.
ref: For those unfamiliar with medical jargon, the words infectious and contagious have distinct meanings. An infectious disease is one that is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacterium, fungus or other parasites. A contagious disease is a disease which is easily transmitted by being in the vicinity of an infected person. Many governments require visitors entering, or residents leaving, their countries to be vaccinated for a range of diseases. These requirements may often depend on what countries a traveller has visited or intends to visit.

src: Sýndareinkanet (VPN-net) eru góð leið til að fara fram hjá bæði pólitískri ritskoðun og  viðskiptatengdum IP-svæðissíum. Þeir eru fremri en vefmiðlari af nokkrum ástæðum: Þeir endurbeina allri netumferð, ekki aðeins http. Þeir bjóða venjulega meiri bandvídd og betri gæði þjónustu. Þau eru dulkóðuð og því erfiðari að njósna um.
mt: VPNs are a good way to go around both political censorship and business-related IP address restrictions. They are better than web proxies for several reasons: They re-route all network traffic, not just HTTP. They usually offer more bandwidth and better service quality. They are encrypted, making it harder to snoop.
ref: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way of circumventing both political censorship and commercial IP-geofiltering. They are superior to web proxies for several reasons: They re-route all Internet traffic, not only http. They normally offer higher bandwidth and better quality of service. They are encrypted and thus harder to spy on.

src: Vegna þess að símtöl fara fram í gegnum netið, þarftu ekki að nota þjónustu símafyrirtækis þar sem þú býrð eða ferðast. Ekki er heldur nein krafa um að þú fáir staðarnúmer frá samfélaginu þar sem þú býrð. Þú getur fengið gervihnattatengingu í óbyggðum Chicken í Alaska og valið númer sem sýnir að þú ert í hinu sólríka Arizona. Oft þarf maður að kaupa sérstaklega alþjóðanúmer sem opnar fyrir möguleikann að PSTN símar geti hringt í þig. Það skiptir það fólk máli sem hringir í þig hvaðan númerið er.
mt: Because phone calls are routed through the Internet, you should not use the service of a phone company where you live or travel. There is no requirement that you get a local number from the community where you live. You can get a virtual number in the sunny Chicken, Alaska, and choose a number that shows you are in the sunny Arizona. Often you have to buy a special international number that allows PSTN phones to call you. It does not matter to people who call you where the number is from.
ref: Because calls are routed over the Internet, you do not need to use a phone company located where you live or where you travel. There is also no requirement that you obtain a local number from the community in which you live; you can obtain a satellite Internet connection in the wilds of Chicken, Alaska and select a number which claims you're in sunny Arizona. Often, you have to buy a global number separately that allows PSTN phones to call you. Where the number is from makes a difference for people calling you.

src: Auðvelt er að bera fram orð á ítölsku því flest þeirra eru borin fram einmitt eins og þau eru rituð Helstu stafirnir sem ber að varast eru c og g, þar sem framburður þeirra er breytilegur eftir þeim sérhljóða sem kemur næst. Gættu þess að bera fram r og rr á ólíkan hátt: Caro þýðir kær en Carro þýðir tvíhjóla stríðsvagn.
mt: It is easy to pronounce Italian words as they are written. The most difficult letters to pronounce are c and g, whose pronunciation varies depending on the preceding consonant. Be careful not to pronounce r and rr the same way: Caro means "dear" but Carro means "two-wheeled war chariot."
ref: Pronunciation is relatively easy in Italian since most words are pronounced exactly how they are written The main letters to watch out for are c and g, since their pronunciation varies based on the following vowel. Also, make sure to pronounce r and rr differently: caro means dear, whereas carro means chariot.

src: İzmir er þriðja stærsta borg Tyrklands með um 3,7 milljónir íbúa, næststærstu höfnina á eftir Istanbúl og er mjög góð samgöngumiðstöð. Hin forna borg Smyrna er núna nútímaleg, þróuð og iðandi viðskiptamiðstöð sem staðsett er við gríðarstóran flóa og umkringd er fjöllum. Hinar breiðu breiðgötur, byggingar með framhliðum úr gleri og nútímalegar verslunarmiðstöðvar með hefðbundnum rauðum þakskífum, 18. aldar markaðurinn og gamlar moskur og kirkjur, þó að andrúmsloft borgarinnar tengist meira Miðjarðarhafssvæði Evrópu en hefðbundnu Tyrklandi.
mt: İzmir is the third largest city in Turkey with a population of 3.7 million, the second largest port after Istanbul and is a very well connected transport hub. The ancient city of Smyrna is now modern, developed and thriving as a commercial centre located on a vast bay and surrounded by mountains. The wide boulevards, buildings with glass fronted facades and modern shopping centres with traditional red tiled roofs, the 18th century market and old mosques and churches, although the city's atmosphere is more Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey.
ref: İzmir is the third largest city in Turkey with a population of around 3.7 million, the second biggest port after Istanbul, and a very good transport hub. Once the ancient city of Smyrna, it is now a modern, developed, and busy commercial center, set around a huge bay and surrounded by mountains. The broad boulevards, glass-fronted buildings and modern shopping centers are dotted with traditional red-tiled roofs, the 18th century market, and old mosques and churches, although the city has an atmosphere more of Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey.

src: Að skoða blómstrandi kirsuberjatré, þekkt sem hanami, hefur verið hluti af japanskri menningu frá því á 8. öld. Hugmyndin á uppruna sinn í Kína þar sem plómublóm var útvalið blóm. Í Japan hélt keisarinn fyrstu veislurnar til að fagna blómsturtíma kirsuberjatrésins aðeins fyrir sjálfan sig og aðra aðalsmenn við keisarahirðina.
mt: To admire the blossoming cherry tree, known as hanami, has been part of Japanese culture since the 8th century. The idea originated in China where the plum blossom was chosen as the flower. In Japan, the emperor held the first parties to celebrate the cherry tree blossoming season only for himself and other high-ranking members of the imperial court.
ref: Cherry blossom viewing, known as hanami, has been a part of Japanese culture since the 8th century. The concept came from China where plum blossoms were the flower of choice. In Japan, the first cherry blossom parties were hosted by the emperor only for himself and other members of the aristocracy around the Imperial Court.

src: Jerúsalem er höfuðborg og stærsta borg Ísraels, þó að flestar aðrar þjóðir og SÞ viðurkenni hana ekki sem höfuðborg Ísraels. Hin forna borg í Júdeuhæðum býr yfir heillandi sögu sem spannar þúsundir ára. Borgin er heilög fyrir þrjú eingyðistrúarbrögð - gyðingdóm, kristni og íslam og þjónar sem andleg, trúarleg og menningarleg miðstöð. Vegna trúarlegs gildis borgarinnar, einkum margra staða í gamla borgarhlutanum, er Jerúsalem einn helsti ferðamannastaðurinn í Ísrael. Jerúsalem er með marga sögulega staði, fornleifastaði og menningarlega staði ásamt líflegum og fjölmennum verslunarmiðstöðvum, kaffihúsum og veitingahúsum.
mt: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, although most other nations and the UN do not recognize it as such. The ancient city of Judea sits atop a mountain range and has a long history spanning thousands of years. The city is holy to three major religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam and serves as a spiritual, religious and cultural center. Because of the city's religious significance, especially in the Old City, Jerusalem is the most important tourist destination in Israel. Jerusalem has many historical sites, archaeological sites and cultural sites along with lively and diverse shopping, coffee shops and restaurants.
ref: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital. The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years. The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center. Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel. Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.

The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years. The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center. Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel. Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.

src: Kruger-þjóðgarðurinn (KNP) er í norðausturhluta Suður-Afríku og liggur meðfram landamærum Mósambík í austri, Simbabve í norðri og suðurlandamærin eru Crocodile River. Almenningsgarðurinn nær yfir 19.500 km² og skiptist í 14 mismunandi vistkerfi sem styðja mismunandi dýralíf. Þjóðgarðurinn er meðal helstu ferðamannastaða Suður-Afríku og er algjör perla á meðal þjóðgarða Suður-Afríku (SANParks). Eins og allir þjóðgarðar í Suður-Afríku er hann undir stöðugri vernd og greiða þarf gjald til að komast inn. Einnig getur verið gagnlegt að kaupa svokallað „Wild Card“ sem veitir aðgang að fjölda þjóðgarða í Suður-Afríku eða öllum þjóðgörðum Suður-Afríku.
mt: Kruger National Park (KNP) is located in northeastern South Africa and borders with Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north and the southern border is Crocodile River. The national park covers 19,500 km² and is divided into 14 different ecosystems that support different wildlife. The national park is one of the most popular tourist destinations in South Africa and is a pearl among the national parks in South Africa (SANParks). As with all national parks in South Africa, it is under constant protection and an entrance fee is required to enter. It is also useful to buy a so-called "Wild Card" which gives access to a number of national parks in South Africa or all national parks in South Africa.
ref: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River. The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife. It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks). As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park. It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.

src: Hátt og bratt fjallið gnæfir yfir norðurhluta Machu Picchu, oft í baksýn ljósmynda af rústunum. Það er frekar óárennilegt séð frá jörðu niðri, hallinn er brattur og erfiður yfirferðar en flestir einstaklingar í sæmilegu líkamlegu ástandi ættu að vera færir um að klifra upp á u.þ.b. 45 mínútum. Steintröppur á mestum mestum hluta stígsins og á brattari stöðum skapa stálvírar handrið. Þú mátt því búast við að verða móður og passaðu þig á brattari svæðum, einkum þegar blautt er, þar sem aðstæður geta fljótt orðið hættulegar. Pínulítill hellir er nálægt toppnum sem verður að fara í gegnum, hann er nokkuð lágur og frekar þröngur.
mt: The mountain looms over the northern part of Machu Picchu, often in the background of photos of the ruins. It is quite steep when seen from the ground, the trail is steep and difficult to climb for most people in good physical condition for about 45 minutes. Rockfall is common on most of the trail and on steeper sections create steel spikes. You should therefore expect to be a mother and take care on steeper sections, especially when wet, where conditions can quickly become dangerous. A narrow and steep canyon is near the top which must be passed through, it is quite low and quite narrow.
ref: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins. It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes. Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail. That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly. There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.

src: Matargerð Mallorca, eins og á álíka svæðum við Miðjarðarhafið, byggist á brauði, grænmeti og kjöti (einkum svínakjöti) og er ólífuolía notuð hvarvetna. Einfaldur vinsæll kvöldverður, sérstaklega yfir sumartímann, er Pa amb Oli: brauð með ólífuolíu, tómötum og öðru áleggi sem er við höndina, t.d. osti, túnfiski o.s.frv.
mt: The cuisine of Mallorca, as in other areas of the Mediterranean, is based on bread, vegetables and meat (especially pork) and olive oil is used everywhere. A simple and popular evening meal, especially in the summer, is Pa amb Oli: bread with olive oil, tomatoes and other toppings at hand, e.g. cheese, tuna etc.
ref: Majorcan cuisine, like that of similar zones in the Mediterranean, is based on bread, vegetables and meat (specially pork), and uses olive oil throughout. A simple popular dinner, especially during the summer, is the Pa amb Oli: Bread with olive oil, tomato, and any available condiments such as cheese, tunafish, etc.

src: Rétturinn Hangi er soðinn í heitri gryfju ofan í jörðu. Gryfjan er annaðhvort hituð með heitum steinum úr eldi, en á sumum stöðum gerir jarðhiti svæðin á jörðinni náttúrulega heit. Hangi er oft notað til að elda hefðbundinn steiktan kvöldverð. Nokkrir staðir í Rotorua bjóða upp á jarðhita hangi en hægt er að prófa annað hangi í Christchurch, Wellington og víðar.
mt: The Hangi is cooked in a heated pit dug into the ground. The pit is heated either with hot stones from a fire, or in some places the geothermal heat of the area makes the ground naturally hot. Hangi is often used to cook traditional steamed evening meal. Some places in Rotorua offer geothermal hangi, but you can also try a hangi in Christchurch, Wellington and elsewhere.
ref: A Hangi Meal is cooked in a hot pit in the ground. The pit is either heated with hot stones from a fire, or in some places geothermal heat makes areas of ground naturally hot. The hangi is often used to cook a traditional roast style dinner. Several places in Rotorua offer geothermal hangi, while other hangi can be sampled in Christchurch, Wellington and elsewhere.

src: Við heimsóknir í munkaklaustur þurfa konur að vera í pilsum sem hylja hnén og hylja axlir sínar. Flest klaustur bjóða upp á sjöl fyrir konur sem koma óundirbúnar, en ef þú kemur með þitt eigið, einkum ef það er í skærum litum, færðu bros frá munkinum eða nunnunni við innganginn. Á sama hátt eru karlmenn skyldaðir til að klæðast buxum til að hylja hnén. Einnig er hægt að fá þetta lánað af lagernum við innganginn. Þær flíkur eru ekki þvegnar eftir hvern notanda. Því gæti þér liðið illa í þessum skyrum. Ein stærð fyrir alla karla!
mt: When visiting a monastery, women must wear a veil that covers the head and shoulders. Most monasteries offer a veil for women who come unprepared, but if you come with your own, especially if it is in bright colors, you will be given a blessing from the monks or nuns at the entrance. Men are required to wear a cassock to cover the head. It is also possible to borrow this from the laymen at the entrance. These veils are not satisfied after any user. You could have a bad time in these colors! One size fits all men!
ref: While visiting the monasteries, women are required to wear skirts covering the knees and have their shoulders covered, too. Most of the monasteries do provide wraps for women who come unprepared, but if you bring your own, especially one with bright colors, you'll get a smile from the monk or nun at the entrance. Along the same line, men are required to wear trousers covering the knees. This too can be borrowed from the stock at the entrance but that clothing isn't washed after every user so you may not feel comfortable wearing these skirts. One size fits all for men!

src: Ef þú ferðast um norðurskautið eða suðurskautið að vetri til færðu tækifæri til að upplifa skautanótt, þ.e.a.s. þegar sólin rís ekki yfir sjóndeildarhringinn. Þetta býður upp á gott tækifæri til að sjá norðurljósin, þar sem himinninn verður myrkur meira og minna allan sólarhringinn. Þar sem svæðin eru strjálbýl og ljósmengun því yfirleitt ekki vandamál muntu einnig geta notið þess að horfa á stjörnurnar.
mt: If you travel north or south of the Arctic Circle in winter, you have the opportunity to experience polar night, i.e. when the sun does not rise above the horizon. This offers a good opportunity to see the aurora, as the sky is darker and brighter throughout the day. As the areas are sparsely populated and light pollution is usually not a problem, you will also be able to see the stars.
ref: If you visit the Arctic or Antarctic areas in the winter you will experience the polar night, which means that the sun doesn't rise above the horizon. This offers a good opportunity to see the Aurora borealis, as the sky will be dark more or less around the clock. As the areas are sparsely populated, and light pollution therefore often not a problem, you will also be able to enjoy the stars.

src: Á afskekktum stöðum, án farsímaþjónustu, er gervihnattasími mögulega eini valkosturinn. Gervihnattasími kemur almennt séð ekki í stað farsíma vegna þess að maður þarf að vera utandyra og í sjónlínu við gervihnöttinn til að geta hringt. Þjónustan er oft notuð af siglingageiranum, þar á meðal skemmtibátum, auk leiðangra sem hafa þörf á fjarskiptagögnum og -rödd. Sá aðili sem veitir símaþjónustu ætti að geta veitt nánari upplýsingar um hvernig megi tengjast þeirri þjónustu.
mt: In remote areas, without cell phone service, a satellite phone may be the only option. Satellite phones are generally not used in place of cell phones because you need to be outdoors and in line of sight of the satellite to make a call. The service is often used by boaters, including pleasure boats, as well as military personnel who need satellite communications and voice. The person providing the satellite phone service should be able to provide more details on how to connect to that service.
ref: In remote locations, without cell phone coverage, a satellite phone may be your only option. A satellite phone is not generally a replacement for a mobile phone, as you have to be outdoors with clear line of sight to the satellite to make a phone call. The service is frequently used by shipping, including pleasure craft, as well as expeditions who have remote data and voice needs. Your local telephone service provider should be able to give more information about connecting to this service.

src: Höfuðborg Moldóvu er Kisínev. Staðarmálið er rúmenska en rússneska er víða notuð. Moldóva er fjölþjóðlegt lýðveldi. Landið hefur þurft að líða fyrir þjóðernisátök. Árið 1994 leiddu þessi stríðsátök til stofnunar hins sjálfskipaða lýðveldis Transnístríu í Austur-Moldavíu sem hefur eigin ríkisstjórn og gjaldmiðil, en er ekki viðurkennt af neinu aðildarríkja Sameinuðu þjóðanna. Aftur hefur verið komið á fót efnahagslegum tengingum milli þessara tveggja hluta Moldóvu þrátt fyrir að pólitískar samningaviðræður hafi siglt í strand. Helstu trúarbrögð í Moldóvu er rétttrúnaðarkristni.
mt: The capital of Moldova is Chișinău. The official language is Romanian, but Russian is widely used. Moldova is a multiethnic republic. It has had to deal with ethnic conflicts. In 1994 these conflicts led to the establishment of the self-proclaimed republic of Transnistria in Eastern Moldova which has its own government and currency, but is not recognized by any member state of the United Nations. Again economic ties have been established between these two parts of Moldova despite political negotiations having stalled. The main religion in Moldova is Eastern Orthodox Christianity.
ref: The capital of Moldova is Chişinău. The local language is Romanian, but Russian is widely used. Moldova is a multi-ethnic republic that has suffered from ethnic conflict. In 1994, this conflict led to the creation of the self-proclaimed Transnistria Republic in eastern Moldova, which has its own government and currency but is not recognised by any UN member country. Economic links have been re-established between these two parts of Moldova despite the failure in political negotiations. The major religion in Moldova is Orthodox Christian.

src: "Því Montevideo er sunnan miðbaugs er sumar þar þegar vetur er á norðurhveli jarðar og öfugt. Montevideo er í heittemptraða beltinu. Á sumrin er algengt að hitastigið sé yfir 30 ° C. Veturinn getur verið blekkjanlega kaldur: hitastig fer sjaldan undir frostmark, en vindur og raki til samans gera að verkum að það virkar kaldara en hitamælirinn segir til um. Það er ekkert sérstakt ""regn-"" og ""þurrka""tímabil: úrkoman er svipuð yfir allt árið."
mt: "Because Montevideo is south of the equator, summer there is when it is winter in the northern hemisphere and vice versa. Montevideo is in the subtropics. In the summers it is common for the temperature to be over 30 °C. The winter can be quite cold: the temperature rarely falls below freezing, but the wind and rain make it feel colder than the thermometer says. There is no distinct "rainy" and "dry" season: the rainfall is similar throughout the year."
ref: "Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa. Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common. The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says. There are no particular ""rainy"" and ""dry"" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year."
